Reviews.Title: “great overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: lianne y
Reviews.Content: stayed at the montana just one night 3rd march 2012. arrived at 10am in morning so we knew that our room would not be ready, but the reception staff were very helpful, told us to leave our luggage at reception and they would take it all to our room for us. (there were 5 of us). we went out for the day and arrived back at 5pm, we went to our room not expecting much as we had read some of the bad reviews. We had a family room for 5 located in the basement, the room was great, we had 3 single beds and a double with ensuite shower room, the room was large enough for us all to feel comfortable in it. We did have a window in the room but it only overlooked a very small square space, but we were not there to stay in our room and admire the view so it did not bother us. The room itself was very clean and comfortable. All the bedding was clean, and beds very comfortable with extra pillows in wardrobe. The bathroom was clean and plent of towels and toilet paper was provided. Our stay at the montana was only a very brief one but it was great the staff were all friendly and helpful and we couldnt complain about anything. would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: charles s
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Montana Hotel for two nights in early March this year to attend an annual business conference in London. My specific requirement was a central London single occupancy accommodation at the best rate, including breakfast. The Montana Hotel provided ideal accomodation for me. Staying in central London can be expensive at any time of the year. The Montana is a smaller four/five storey hotel located at the heart of Kensington & Chelsea and close to Gloucester Road tube station. The hotel offers good value room rates including continental breakfast, ideal for short stay visitors to London where no more than basic ‘Bed & Breakfast’ type facilities are required. My room was a very comfortable single with standard room facilities including a wash basin, TV and internet, no en-suite, the shared bathroom was a short walk down the corridor. I enjoyed my continental breakfast in the restaurant, a dining room which becomes the ‘Light of India’ restaurant for evening dining, acknowledged to be one the very best restaurants for Indian cuisine in Kensington. I shall definitely consider staying at the Montana for any future trips to London.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Stay”
Reviews.Author: daytrippergla
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice stay in this hotel, staff very helpfull and room good too. Very handy location for tube and museums. Nice breakfast with toast

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: TravellingAussie1
Reviews.Content: I booked the large (20 sq m) single room with a shared bathroom, and was upgraded to an ensuite room on arrival. While the upgraded bedroom was smaller than 20sq m, the private bathroom was big and a bonus. For 45 pounds a night including breakfast, and only minutes across the road from Gloucester Road tube (which is itself on the Piccadily line direct from Heathrow airport) this is great value and well located.

Reviews.Title: “2 day short stay”
Reviews.Author: roger j
Reviews.Content: we stopped here for 2 nights in the family room 2 adults and 3 kids . could not fault it ,clean,friendly staff ,beds and linen spotless and changed daily ,yes only a small bar of soap but who does not take there toiletries with them .would def stop here again and recomened .

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms in a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: MissJaneM
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 3 nights at the Montana hotel in June 2011. We expected the usual "rabbit hutch" sized room that is the norm for budget - moderate hotels in central London but were very pleasantly surprised to find our twin room quite spacious. The bathroom was also a reasonable size and had the luxury of a bath (as well as the shower overhead). The beds were comfy, there was a wardrobe and room to place your suitcases. The decor is somewhat dated but all is clean and comfortable. The absolute best thing about the hotel is its' location - within easy walking distance of (for example) the V & A, the Science Museum and Harrods. The Montana is just 4 minutes walk from the Glouster Road Tube stop. The hotel is within minutes of many useful amenities - cafe's, pubs, Tesco Express, Waitrose (behind the Tube station), patisseries, greengrocers and restaurants. Almost directly opposite the hotel is a Post Office/tourist centre and a few doors along from that an internet cafe (the biggest problem I had with the Montana was that the wi-fi constantly dropped out). Also opposite are Barclays bank ATMs. The hotel itself is on a very busy road but you barely hear the traffic in your room. The hotel has a good sized lift. The Montana is clean and spacious, the staff were, on the whole, cheerful and helpful - especially the breakfast staff. The breakfast included is a simple but ample meal of cereal, tinned fruits, toast and toppings, coffee or tea - as much as you can eat and drink. A cooked breakfast can be purchased if you wish. The breakfast is served in the "Light of India" restaurant which is attached to the hotel. We also had dinner here one night - it was very good and quite reasonably priced for a London restaurant. Just a small 'heads up', the Montana does not provide bathroom toiletries of any kind (apart from tiny soaps) nor does it provide any bathroom linen apart from bath-towels. I did find this a bit strange, but necessity being the mother of invention, solved our problem by buying some "Chux wipes" at the Waitrose supermarket and using them as bath mats and hand towels. Plenty of loo paper was provided in the bathroom. Also, when we arrived there were no tea-making facilities in the room but a call to reception had a tray delivered within minutes. Altogether we found this a very comfortable and convenient base to explore the area of London we most wished to see.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Kim K
Reviews.Content: During my parents first trip to visit London we booked rooms here for a weekend in November to show them how wonderful London was, unfortunately we picked the worst hotel. The rooms were absolutely awful. No toiletries offered except for a small bar of hand soap and one roll of toilet paper. There was a step up into the bathroom from the room, not only did I trip/slip over it getting out of the shower, because there wasn't a bathmat in the bathroom, but my child did as well. The bed covers were dirty and had dust around the bottom edges. The room was extremely stuffy and we opened the window, but because the traffic on the street was so loud we could not sleep with the windows open. We thought our room was bad, but when we went up to the next floor where my parents room was located, their room was even smaller and smelled of damp and mold. My husband went to complain about the rooms and the man on the front desk laughed in his face as if my husband was joking. When my husband asked to speak to the manager, he was told that it wouldn't be possible, and that the front desk man would call the manager. This was the first night we stayed, we had to stay one more night after this and were given dirty looks by the staff for the extent of our stay. The front desk man said that the manager would get in touch with my husband by phone, he never did, and we emailed the hotel to discuss the situation and no one has gotten back with us. We gave them a month to respond to us about receiving a discount/money back on our stay, and haven't received satisfaction to this day, so I'm writing this review. I've taken it upon myself to let friends and colleagues know what a horrible experience we received so they wont stay here. My parents have also let a local paper where they live back in America know how horrible the experience was, as well as several social medial sites. I know that this review will also be laughed at as this is apparently the "norm" for the staff here at the Montana. Please save your money and pick another hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Thankyou for saving us!!”
Reviews.Author: tracie m
Reviews.Content: After being turned away from a disgusting hotel because they said it had been cancelled.. we were stranded in London. 4 of us with theatre tickets for that night and coach tickets for the next day. We didnt know what to do and it was 4pm. We saw this hotel and never thought they would be able to help us but they could and they did. Brilliant staff, room and atmosphere. We went from being so upset to so happy. Thankyou Montana and staff. Will definately use your hotel again.

Reviews.Title: ““A good place to stay””
Reviews.Author: spruzzz
Reviews.Content: First trip to London,England........Three guys in are late 30's from Montreal on vacation for seven days. From October 17,2011 to October 24,2011 Airport to Hotel: We landed at Gatwick airport.....From the airport we took the Gatwick Express train to Victoria station which took about 30-35 min. I suggest to take the Anytime Return ticket. It cost £30.80 per person but if you book it on line it cost £25.90.... This is the web site to book on line: http://www.gatwickexpress.com/en/tickets-and-fares/buy-online-and-save/....Now from Victoria station you take the tube on the distract line three stations to Gloucester station its about 10 min. When exiting Gloucester station the hotel is practically across the street from the station about half a block to the left. I had a friend from Italy that met us up from for the weekend that landed at Heathrow airport. He explained to me that he took the tube from the terminal Heathrow station which is located on the Piccadilly Line straight to Gloucester station it took him 45 min to an hour. Location: Great location.... Your close to some of the major attractions . 5 min. walk to Natural History Museum (Must see place) . 7 min walk to Albert Hall .10 min walk to Hyde Park (Beautiful and very!,Very!!,Very!!! Big Park big, nice swans in the pond) . 15 min walk to Harrods Department store (Incredible store, Very good food in the food court, Hope you have lots of money.....Very expensive to shop. Besides the attractions yo have a little mall across the street with a big grocery store and a few restaurants. In front of the hotel is a little souvenir shop where you can bye post cards, phone cards etc....You have Starbucks,Burger King,K.F.C close by. A grocery store that is opened 24 hours a day. It has good beer selection but be advised you only can't buy alcohol after 11:00 p.m. Coffee shops and a couple of PUBS that close around 10:00 p.m. ATM machines right around the corner and one next to the 24 hour grocery store store. Rooml: We were staying in room 205.... It consist of a small fridge & safe. Double bed & single bed,nice LCD TV that only catches a few channels but you can order movies if you like. Phone where you can make In & Out calls but it cost money to make outs call even though your calling people in the city of London. Big Long Desk,Big Closet,cofffee maker. As for the bathroom it had a little shower, the water pressure is decent but not great. Toiilet & sink and hair dryer.... The room is very! Very!! small but clean the maids come in every morning to make up the beds give you new towels and soap... If you wanted an extra towel just let the maid know. All in all great room bed is comfortable and and you have clean sheets every day. They have free wi fi... and it always worked. Just need to go to front desk to access it. The only problems we had in the room was the T.V. Sometimes it was not working. Staff could not fix it. But we were not there to watch T.V.... One of my friends that was with me on this trip lost or got his watch stolen. It was the only thing missing in the room. WEIRD Sleep: Quiet place to get a good night sleep. No distractions what so ever. Hotel: Check in was fast.....The staff is great and helpful. Front desk has maps of the city and the tourist guides of the city. Don't be shy with the staff they know the city well and they will tell you what to check out. There is this one staff member at the front desk. I forgot his name he's bald with glasses but he was really helpful, ask him about the strip-joints in London... He's going to tell you a hell of a story. They have a 'Lions Bar' in the lobby but we did not try it. They have a computer right next to it but never worked. Elevator is small can fit 2 -3 people depending your size....lol... I think my friend broke it at one point when he startled to jump up and down in it. Restaurant: Breakfast: Not much variety...Three types of cereal,(canned) peaches and pears,Orange & Apple Juice... White & brown toast always hot with some types of jam,Banana's All the Tea & coffee you can drink. You can order eggs or sausage but it's an extra. All-in-All it's a decent breakfast and the waiters are helpful on the refills. For lunch and dinner its an Indian restaurant, we did not get the chance to eat there as we always ate out. Over-all I give this hotel 3.5 STARS.... by the way I'm a picky person. Remember to shut the curtains before you go to bed You really got to know where to go to eat. Very expensive city. I would not recommend to eat in the vicinity unless its Harrods Department store. My favourite place to eat was in Camden town in the market area.... So much to choose from and for a great price.... For £5 you have a massive plate of food, the only thing its a 30 min travel time by tube but worth the trip. Over-all I give this hotel 3.5 STARS.... by the way I'm a picky person. If you want more information about the hotel and the surrounding areas or where to go to eat. You can e-mail at .......morte_di_fame@hotmail.com Cheers!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again - very nice and great location!”
Reviews.Author: AugMomto3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 3 young daughters from Nov 19 -22nd. When choosing a location several things were very important to me: cost needed to be reasonable, location to the subway needed to be very close, and we wanted to be close to the Victoria area of London. The Montana Hotel was the best choice for us - after hours of online searching for hotels. We had a very nice room for 4 people. It had a double bed and 2 singles. The bathroom was large enough with a sink, toilet, and bathtub with shower. The location was excellent. It was quite literally across the street and 1/2 a block down from the Gloucester Road Tube Station on both the Cirle and District Lines. This is 3 stops down (or about 5 minutes away) from Victoria Station. We are able to get a flight into Gatwick, and then took that Gatwick Express to Victoria, and transferred to the Tube to get to our hotel. Very easy, even for a parent on their own who had never been to London, with luggage and 3 kids under 10 in tow. My girls absolutely loved the tiny lift which barely fit the 4 of us and 2 small suitcases. Personally, if you were were claustrophobic - I would opt for the stairs! Our room was on the 3rd floor. It was very nice and very quite. We had breakfast in the restaurant each day, and didn't order any extras and were satisfied until lunch. The coffee and tea were unending, and there was a very nice selection of cereal, toast and (canned) peaches and pears, along with melon. Orange and apple juice were also available. We did not see the need to order more. Our room was ready when we arrived at 10am, however it would not have been a problem to store our luggage there before or after check out, so that we could start our vacation. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Sackie14
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel. Not flash or luxury, but really comfy, clean & friendly. Excellent location, across the road from tube station & a 10 minute walk to Hyde Park, Harrods, Natural History Museum & Albert Hall. Free Wi Fi. Nice breakfast. Enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Robins58
Reviews.Content: Superb location for Natural History Museum - friendly and very helpful reception staff - breakfast better than expected. Excellent family room (for 4) - suited us v well to get three beds. Just a minor point but it would have been good to have got a bath mat and extra toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: cbpellet
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 2 nights. I don't think that I would stay there again since the water pressure was terrible and there was no (I mean NO) hot water. My bed spread had a hole in it. If you do stay, bring your toileteries since they supply a very small soap. Besides that, it is very convient to the tube, grocery store, ATM, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, good price”
Reviews.Author: Lau1967
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Montana for 4 nights, room was small (it is Europe) but clean, employees are really nice. Location is great: grocery store (there is a small fridge in the room), tube stations, coffee shops are right across the street. 3 tube lines get to it (Picadelli, circle and district). Bring your shampoo and face towels since they only supply soap and 1 large towel. Free internet.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Deep in the heart of Texas
Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: coyotedude
Reviews.Content: Let us check-in early, room small but recently remodeled and nice, excellent location to tube with neighborhood stores and pubs nearby. Staff friendly and free breakfast adequate. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, good value”
Reviews.Author: JB07
Reviews.Content: We visited London for a family holiday and wanted a reasonably-priced place to stay. The Montana provided excellent accomodation for the price compared to other London hotels at which we have stayed. The rooms were clean and comfortable and seem to have been recently upgraded. The service was outstanding with the staff ready to help with just about anything we needed. We will definitely return if we have the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Lazy_Glenn
Reviews.Content: Great location, We only needed a place for the night because of an early flight out. Had a lower then street level window, that smelt like a urinal. Staff were pleasant. Room and Hotel were clean and tidy. Breakfast ... The cook was obviously very sick , while setting up the little buffet, it did look good but.... we had some cereal and coffee. We got what we expected, and what we paid for. Within walking distance to a lot of Pubs.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, helpful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: sanditaly
Reviews.Content: This is a great little three star hotel. My single room was small but very clean and the location is perfect. Woud definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “"We loved it and we'll be back!"”
Reviews.Author: London311
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. The tube is very close to the hotel as well as restaurants and stores. We were made to feel welcomed right from the start.The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were a good size, continental breakfast was good and enjoyed sitting talking at the bar. We would recommend this hotel to everyone. We would definitely go and stay there next time we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Montana Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheJingles
Reviews.Content: What a friendly place to stay. We were here for three days with our children and we had a great time. The staff were attentive and very helpful with all our requirements. The price was very competitive against neighbouring establishments. The location was tops with the tube station opposite. The room was very clean and spacious with everything we needed. This is a wonderful family owned hotel. We have already rebooked for October half-term. Thank you very much to all at the Montana.

Reviews.Title: “A different London experience”
Reviews.Author: cornishman65_11
Reviews.Content: A friendly hotel unlike previous visits to London. The staff are friendly and actually speak to you. Nothing was too much trouble. My wife became unwell during our visit which made us cut short our visit. Staff were understanding and put us at ease until we left allowing us to have breakfast in our room arranging a taxi etc. The room and facilities were good and we would not hesitate to ever stay if in London again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was bad but the location. Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Sylaz8
Reviews.Content: We booked a DOUBLE room over the phone which was confirmed by the receptionist. When we got to the hotel, they gave us only a single room and they made us pay for another single room in supplement because we were 2!!! We complained nad although late at night, the receptionist said that the manager would be back in 20 mn and we should come back then to sort out the rooms. We came back and another person was more than rude to us. He would not listen and kept on talking over me when I was trying to explain the situation. He was disrespectful so even less helpful. He refused to help us until we almost had to beg for him to listen, literally! When he finally decided to look into his computer for us, he just siad that we'll have to sort this out in the morning as the manager is not there. NOT useful since we were staing 1 night! We were just so fed up that we just gave up. In the meantime, they still haven't refunded the extra room that we had to take. The room themselves are smaller than university dormitories. The en-suite bathroom is even bigger than the room itself! The single bed is trully a single bed, don't move too much or you'll fall out of the bed. Inside, it was old fashioned and the lamp was struggling to work! The price was extortionate for what we got and the worst was the poor level of respect from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Yuk! Fungus in the Bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: Deb1984
Reviews.Content: Not at all worth what we payed for... Location was good though...

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsSJF
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend. It is in a fabulous location- across the street from the Gloucester underground station. The Natural History Museum and Kensington Gardens are within walking distance away. We stayed on two occasions during our last trip. The first time we were on the third flour facing the rear of the hotel. The room was comfortable, but the bathroom was extremely small. Shower pressure was poor. The rooms were comfortable- good beds, decor was dated, bedding was worn but clean. The rooms have a fridge and free WIFI. The WIFI is limited to browsing only - no downloads and for some reason you had to put in a "override" code for pretty much any internet site you wanted to visit. On our second occasion we were initially assigned to a room in the 500 range. This ended up being in the basement- no outside windows, only a window overlooking the laundry facilities. It also smelled musty. We went back to the desk and requested another room, which the staff graciously gave us. Our room was on the third floor facing the street. It was a great room, big bathroom, and a shower with good pressure. The only issue was that the t.v. was not working. We mentioned this to the front desk staff on three occasions, but the t.v. was never looked at and we were not informed of what the issue was. Other than that issue, the front desk staff was friendly, helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, The Illegal.”
Reviews.Author: JetVortex
Reviews.Content: You hear lots of stories on how expensive London accommodation is, and how you are normally disappointed you are with what your have paid for. The Good. This was the start of our European Adventure, 5 nights in London, 2 Adults, 2 Teens and 1 Child, after lots of internet searching we found the Montana, excellent location, great area, the tube latterly right at the door. We booked a family room, the rate was ok for London standards, GBP160. We arrived at 2.00pm in the friendly check-in staff, small reception area, outside lived up to the internet pictures, we were advised that our booked room had suffered water damage from the room above and it would be unavailable, so they gave us 2 rooms for our stay and would only charge us the family room rate, not a problem, girls in 1, boys in the other. Rooms were very clean, well looked after, beds and furnishing were comfortable, bonus was a very large screen TV….my 8 year old was happy. No noise at night from the street, windows are double glazed. We were actually very happy. Continental breakfast was included, tea/coffee/hot chocolate, toast, cereal, juice and fruit, enough to start the day. Everything was going well until night 2 when we came back at 7.00pm. The Bad and The Illegal. The lift is very small, only hold 2 people or 1 person with 2 bags, we start our journey up to the 3rd floor, my keycard does not work, my wife and the girls access there room, its been cleared out, no suit cases, no cloths, no dirty cloths, no jewelry, no nothing. We all race down stairs in a major panic, reception then informs us that the family room has been cleaned up and they have decided to move us to our original booking, house keeping packed up all our belongings…….talk about being violated and an invasion of privacy especially for the 3 girls, worst was yet to come, in my room was the safe containing 5 passports and cash. They would not allow us to gain access to that room as they had checked in other guests and did not want to disturb them, well I went off and the fun and games started for the next 2 hours….at this point please use your imagination. To cut a very long story short this is the out come, stuff the other guests get me in or police will be called, found out it was illegal for them to touch or move our items to another room with out our permission, we did not accept the family room at that point out of principle, plus there were still large yellow water stains in the ceiling tiles and they were still wet, the guests in my room did give me access to “there” room so I could access the safe, they actually saw the happenings in reception. I made the receptionist phone the manager, he said it was just a lack of communication, he would not come to the hotel to speak to me, he actually was never at the hotel during our 5 days, we were advised that even though the had given us 2 rooms we should just accept what we had booked, that was not happening, after more shouting, and proving it was illegal for the staff to move our items they gave us another 2 rooms, at the family rate. With the exception of the incident, I can say the Montana Hotel is a nice place to stay in a nice area, but after what had happened to my family, I will tell everyone to avoid the hotel like the plague, the staff are deceitful, liars, the manager/owner accepts no responsibility for the actions of his staff or his own. How can you touch the personal items of guests and just move them, pack there items into KFC bags, be more concerned about other guests that now have your room. Value for money Hotel in a Great Area, but KEEP AWAY, keep all your email correspondence, take nothing at face value. We have lodging a complaint with the British Inn Keepers association, and how did we prove it was illegal to move our belongings….we went to the 4.5 Star Hotel next door and they gave us some very helpful advice.

Reviews.Title: “over booked”
Reviews.Author: colmarfab
Reviews.Content: Last Christmas, we decided to spend 3 days in London, in spring. So I booked the 3 double rooms at the Montana Hotel and got the confirmation of reservation in January. The day before we left, we got a phonecall and thus confirmed our coming. When we arrived we were told that the hotel was overbooked and that 2 couples would be sent into other hotels not very far. We weren't very pleased because at the special requests we had asked to be on the same floor and once there they told us we wouldn't even be in the same hotel ! So the receptionist said he was trying to find 2 other rooms in a hotel, at a higher standard. so he sent us in the same street, 15 mn away from the Montana. When we arrived there we found a filthy room with torn curtains, no carpet on the floor and a dirty bathroom. so we decided not to stay there and went back to the Montana. They finally found 2 rooms in the hotel next door which was being renewed but the rooms were brand new and that time the standard of the hotel was higher, indeed. As a result we lost nearly 3 hours trying to get a suitable accomodation I had booked for in January for the 3 couples. and the receptinist asked me to stay calm .. oh, I forgot while we were waiting at the reception another family arrived and got two rooms still avalable in the hotel. Unbelievable Well the good point is that they offered us the English breakfast as a compensation and of course the hotel is well located.

Reviews.Title: “really good hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: SLY520
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our 23 yr old daughter spend 4 nights in the Montana. It was a perfect hotel for us .The room had a double bed and a single bed with plenty of room for our suitcases. It had a mini fridge, hair dryer and free wi-fi. Most importantly, it was quiet, very clean and the water pressure was great! Breakfast was included. Basic toast, cereal, fruit, coffee, tea and for a small charge you can get eggs. There was always someone at the front desk and they could not have been nicer. Always willing to help and direct. I needed an extra adapter and they lent me one. The small lobby has a bar and a computer to use for a small fee. The location was the best. Less than one block from the Gloucester Tube stop which is on the Piccadilly Line. From this tube line you can get anywhere, including the airport. There was also a supermarket, HSBC bank, a couple of pubs and restaurants . Walking distance you can get to Kensington Park or to the V&A and a little further, Harrods! We usually took the tube in the evening to Covent garden to go to dinner and walk around We ate at Zizzi's, a great Italian Restaurant and Wahaca a great mexican restaurant. The Montana Hotel really made our stay in London the greatest experience and besides, we were basically out of the room all day sightseeing. So, if you are looking for a hotel room to be in all day and you are looking for something expensive and luxurious then this is not the hotel for you. If you are looking for a great hotel in a great location for a great price, you have found your place! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Real Value”
Reviews.Author: snookerpaul
Reviews.Content: Our Visit starts not good. The receptionist couldn't find our reservation fortunately, we had a written confirmation, so we got rooms. The rooms were good furnitured and had a couple of facilities - air condition, hairdryer, flat-TV, coffee- and tea maker - and the bed was comfortable. Continental breakfast was ok, additionals could be ordered at decent prices. Between 8.30 and 9 the breakfast room was crowded but the service tried their best - the waiter was very friendly. Rooms were a bit noisy due to traffic and generators in the inner courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: debbiesmuts
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Montana just for two nights - a triple room - I was travelling with my 16 year old son and his friend. The room was in the basement - small with three single beds and a bathroom - but entirely adequate and clean, and best of all, quiet! As it happened, my son and his friend's flights were cancelled due to the snow and I ended up having to leave them behind in London for a week before they were able to get on another flight. The hotel staff were so kind and helpful - giving me a great rate for the boys to stay on and promising to keep an eye on them. Made me feel so much more comfortable about leaving the kids behind. The location is fantastic - right across the road from the tube station, a Tesco's down the road and all the London sites close by. I will definately stay here again. It's not the Ritz, it's more like home!!

Reviews.Title: “friendly,efficient,clean,quiet,shower hot+powerful,yummy indian meal.”
Reviews.Author: whatwhywhen
Reviews.Content: thanks for lovely time at montana. everyone friendly+efficient. room always clean+quiet. shower hot +powerful. best indian meal we have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: gbergin
Reviews.Content: As everyone notes, London is an extremely expensive place to stay as a tourist, but we managed to find a good deal on this hotel (£360 for 4 nights in a double) and decided to try it out. We had no problems with the service and the breakfast, while not expansive in what it offered, was good. The room was large and comfortable, but the bathroom was quite small and with a very noisy fan, which kept going for a while after turning off the lights. All in all, it was just what we were looking for, a great location next to a tube station on a very good line (for us) and rooms that were comfy enough to let us enjoy the time we didn't spent in the city.

Reviews.Title: “The Web Page Does Not Lie, It Just Hides The Truth”
Reviews.Author: The_Walrus2
Reviews.Content: Bravo to the Web Page designer for the Montana Kensington Hotel. He/she certainly fooled me. The photos on the Web Page are delibertely hazy or are close-ups that do not show the age of the beds and bedding, the thinness of the towels, the indifferent reception staff, the lack of toiletries, or the camper-sized en suite bathroom. Don't have great expectations and you will not be disappointed. This is not a 3.5 star hotel! But the location, and proximity to the tube is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel in a Good Area.”
Reviews.Author: V4Supernatural
Reviews.Content: Me along with two of my friends found a great package deal from Air Transat for a decent price and took it instantly. While researching the possible hotel options we saw the mixed reviews on the Montana and thought we would give it a chance. I have stayed in some scummy motels and hotels before so we had no expectations for the Montana. I have been to London before and knew the area was fantastic so we didn't expect to spend any time in the hotel room at all. When we first got into the hotel it seemed very nice. No ones room was ready from our group so we were told to leave our bags in the back and go explore the area while we waited, which is exactly what we did. Two hours later when we returned from lunch we discovered that our room still wasn't ready. So we waited another hour and we finally were placed in a room. Now I have never seen a hotel with basement rooms but we were exhausted and willing to give it a chance. The room was very dirty and had only one window which was a fire exit. The sheets had black smears on them, the wall paper was torn, and the room felt like a storage area with all the extra furniture. But the reason we asked for a new room was the sewage smell. The bathroom was disgusting! The shower had brown sludge all over the base and walls and the toilet paper had black smears on it. Which was probably due to the towels, toilet paper and sheets being stored on the floor in the hallways outside the rooms. (A fact that we asked about at the front desk and were told that they never did, despite the pictures I had taken.) When we went upstairs to see if they had any other rooms, we were told that they had no openings and that we would have to ask the next day but they didn't think it would be possible. They also sent someone down to look at the bathroom, which proved to be useless. The man told us "the smell was a mixture of perfume and cigarettes" so we knew we were stuck in the room. Feeling a little used I decided to call Air Transat and see if there was anything they could do since we paid for a 5 star hotel and got a 2. Immediately after I had called Air Transat we got a call from the front desk saying that they had a room for us. We were moved to a room on the top floor which was much nicer than the first. The bathroom was clean and we had actual windows! From then on the staff were nice, unlike they were at the beginning. The front desk clerk told me when we were moved to "immediately call Air Transat and tell them you are very happy with your room" which I found a little weird since we hadn't even seen the room yet. But the next day as we walked downstairs we ran into another guest as he was yelling at the front desk clerk. Apparently he had gotten a room like our old basement room and had paid $500 for it. So we were happy to see that others were equally as disgusted by the shape of the rooms. But all in all after the first day and that horrible room mishap we had a very nice stay. If you ever stay here MAKE SURE you get a 4th floor room! They still store their linens on the floor in the hallways but somehow they seem to clean the rooms better. The breakfast is amazing and the wait staff is very nice! They always remembered our orders and never let our coffee's go empty. If you do stay here, stay for the area and not for the hotel! The tube is literally a 2 minute walk from the hotel and they have some good restaurants around for a quick snack along with a bakery, a grocery store and of coarse a couple of pubs! Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as the last time I stayed there”
Reviews.Author: am5
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Montana several times in the past. I always like the excellent location right in Kensington and across from the Gloucester Road Tube. For the price, you really can't beat that location. This time I stayed in a room with two twin beds. We were fortunate to be put in a room on the back of the hotel, something that has never happened on my previous stays there. The back of the hotel over looks a mews and is MUCH quieter than the front side on the corner of Gloucester/Cromwell Roads. My complaints this time were with the cleanliness and size of the room. This is England, so I expected the rooms to be small but our bathroom was extremely tiny. I've stayed in other twin rooms at this hotel and they had much larger bathrooms compared to what we were given. You could basically only stand up in it and turn around and that's it. The shower had black mold growing in the corners and edges and I didn't really enjoy that but I put up with it since we were only staying for one night. My other problem was with the staff. Before we arrived they quoted me a discount rate and I had emails to confirm that I booked the room at that rate. They seemed hesitant to give it to me upon check-in and wanted to charge me more. They said I would have to bring it up upon check-out. That was annoying because for the next day I had to worry about it and keep reminding myself to bring it up with the staff again upon check-out. They seemed hesitant to give me the rate at check out again, and I had to pull out my paperwork to show them what they had quoted me and that I had reserved that rate. Finally they gave it to me. But, all the time they took and the questioning they gave me about how why they had quoted me that rate left a bad taste in my mouth. I would stay here again just because it is in a neighborhood that I like and because it includes free breakfast. But, just be aware that the rooms in this hotel vary significantly: you could end up with a larger and noisy room or a really small room like we had this time that is quieter. If I stayed again I would be sure to book the room well in advance (because the rooms were even cheaper much earlier on their website compared to the quote they gave me when I booked at a date closer to my arrival date), and I would be sure to bring all of your paperwork with you in case the front desk questions your booking.

Reviews.Title: “A Lousy Hotel located in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cityrentals-berlin
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel based on the reviews of other guest but the reviews and those reviews do not reflect the reality of the hotel. 1st, A really small room, with an uncomfortable bed 2nd, a shared shower and toilet with few rooms, the bathroom does not have a heating unit 3rd- Breakfast Buffet, there is not such thing unless you consider breakfast a bawl of cereal, and juice breakfast 4- Internet, half of the sites you will try to open are blocked and the connection is really slow, so if you have to work you will have to pay for an internet connection via BT or other hotspot provider. 5- the elevator is really small the maximum capacity is one person without luggage

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: tannythestar
Reviews.Content: hotel looks really nice outside. We were only about 15 minutes early for check-in but our room wasn't really and we were asked to come back at 2 pm although check-in time was supposed to be 1 pm according to our confirmation from Hotel.com After waiting at the lobby (using wifi) for about half an hour, the room was ready. Our reception didn't look so welcoming. He wasn't rude but not too friendly either. Elevator was very small and slow but sufficient for moving our luggages. Other times we just walked the stairs. Wifi wasn't working in the room so we could only use it when in the lobby. Breakfast was adequate

Reviews.Title: “A Block from the TUBE!”
Reviews.Author: nanceb4019
Reviews.Content: The Montana hotel is in a great location for sightseeing! We spent 4 nights there and it could not have been handier! I would recommend it to others and if I return to London will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for visit to London”
Reviews.Author: williamoreilly
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently in this hotel while on a short break to London. The location is excellent for visiting London with a tube station nearby and also within walking distance for many of the city's attractions. Breakfast was very good and the bar service, run by Peter was excellent. We used the adjoining Indian Restaurant for one evening meal, which again was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LONDON TRIP”
Reviews.Author: HOGG00007
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 7 nights lodging at the Montana and it was great. The rooms are small as rooms always are in Europe but clean and tidy. When one travels to London, one does not travel there to stay in the room, so the room was perfect. The room was quiet, clean and big enough. The location is very good in that one has the Tube right there, a grocery store near by, museums near by, great pubs, Kensington park is 5 min walk and the tour buses stop right by the hotel. Staff is very friendly "ELVIS" and very good. The breakfast is light but very good and fresh. When we go back to London, this hotel will be my first choice to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Great Location Makes For A Wonderful Trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: TWEE006
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 7 nights. This hotel is situated in the best location. A few steps from the Gloucester tube station, a grocery store and many wonderful pubs, where the food is very good and the ale's are cold(Gloucester Arms). Also you're in walking distance to alot of major attractions, The Royal Albert Hall is about 10 min. walk and that also takes you to the beautiful Kensington Park and Hyde Park. If you ask the locals if you could walk to Buckingham Palace or Trafalgar Square they will say it's a very far walk and they say to take the tube or taxi. From our perspective you don't see anything in the tube but one thing when you are on holidays and you have time it is a beautiful walk and it's only about 45 mins. to an hour to these areas. We do recommend that you try the Big Bus Tour, great value for what you all see and it's a hop on hop off with a city cruise on the river Thames. The staff at Montana Hotel are by far the most friendliest we've expereinced. Elvis, thank you for your wonderful hospitality. He always had some great suggestions for us. On the morning we were leaving (6:30am) he visited with us and brought us some coffee and juice while we were waiting for the airport transfer driver. Also thank you to the gentlemen with blondish hair that brought us toast in the morning. He told us when the changing of the guards were and we got to see it on the last day in London. Our room was nice and clean everyday, it had 1 double bed and an ensuite bathroom. The room and bathroon was smaller but that's all you need for a good sleep. There was a security box in the closet, had wireless internet, refridgerater, coffee and tea in the room as well. They don't supply shampoo or conditoner so you must bring your own or buy there. We knew this because of trip advisor. They only had 2 towels in the room so we asked for 1 more and we got 2 extra. Overall we would definitely recommend this great hotel to anyone staying in London for any length of time. Thanks again to the great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel; room and staff were brilliant, will definately stay again.”
Reviews.Author: gay-twist
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel and our stay was fantastic. Beautiful setting, a minute from the tube and very well maintained from the outside, to the lobby, to the bedroom we had and the restaurant for breakfast. Everything is very clean and fresh and the bedroom with both a double and single bed was more than big enough for me and my mum to relax in after a hard days shopping. Very clean ensuite bathroom, TV in the bedroom and a lift for the disabled like me all contributed to a great stay. The only thing we didn't have was a tea/coffee tray in the room but I am sure if we had asked one would have been provided, we were just too tired to be bothered on this particular trip! All of the staff we dealt with were extremely friendly and helpful, especially the gentleman on the front desk who was polite and beyond helpful, especially in booking us a cab to Euston at a good price and at short notice thanks to the tube closure. I would, and have, already recommended this hotel to friends and will definately stay here again, hopefully very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: 4Piffs
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Heathrow from Canada and found easy access to the Tube on the Picadilly Line. Travel time to the Gloucester Street Station during peak time was about 45 minutes. Exiting left from the Gloucester Street station, we walked about 3 minutes and crossed the road to the hotel. Location is terrific, they have an Indian restaurant in the hotel and a small elevator. The breakfast is simple but enough (fruit, ceral, toast, juice and coffee). We had a quiet room facing the main road that was air conditioned and we didn't have any issue with noise. The area has a lot of restaurants, cafes, money exchange and a small mall beside the Gloucester Street Tube where you can shop for groceries (Waitrose and a Boots pharmacy). Access to tourist areas is very easy as the Picadilly line includes stops to Covent Garden (theatre/shopping), Knightsbridge (Harrod's) and a ton of other popular sights. The hotel was clean, simple and fit the needs for my family. The bathroom is a bit small compared to North American standards, but it was fine and clean. I would gladly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: avoca146
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nites in a family room for 5 people (3 kids under 10). Room 500 on the ground floor had no view but was spacious, very clean and had 2 double beds and one large single as well as ensuite bathroom (with bath) and fridge. London was 32 degrees the day we arrived and we were so glad of the air conditioning. The hotel is opposite Gloucester Road Tube Station and also easily reached by various buses to central London, as well as being within walking distance to all the museums. Breakfast was continental style with cooked breakfast incurring an additional charge of about £7 per head. Staff lovely with english barman being particularly helpful. There is a Tesco, Waitrose, Burger King, Patisserie, Pub, Boots Chemist, Post Office, Hair Salon and Newsagent right beside the hotel which is really handy. The hotel is a little 1980s in style but this is outweighed by the pleasant staff and we will definitely stay here again on our next trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: perrjojo
Reviews.Content: The location was just across the street from the Gloucester Tube Station which is served by the District, Circle and Picadilly lines....perfect to get most anywhere. The staff was friendly and helpful. Several other reviewers complained that the rooms were too small and not that nice for the price but I did think they were typical of any European hotel in that price range. The elevator was tiny but again this is typical. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant value for money, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Anne9920
Reviews.Content: This is an excellant hotel for viiting V&A Natural History Museums and perfect for the Royal Albert Hall Concerts. Walkng back is safe and well lit. It is easy to book either on line or by phone. Rememberto ask in advance for Tea/Coffee making facilities and it will be in your room on arrival. Very willing to look after your luggage whilst visiting museums. All the staff are very pleasant and most helpful. Only one comment only soap and towel provided no other toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rcjohn47
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel towards the end of February. The location is great. That alone makes it a great place to stay. A very safe and friendly neighborhood. The room I was in was 201. No great view but everything else was alright. Comfortable but not elegant. Oh and by the way the hair dryers are in the drawers. One member of our party when out and bought one before she found out where it was.. Minor complains are the soap is so small it is practically useless and the glass they they put in the bathroom is the only one. And yes the internet service downstairs that costs a pound for 20 minutes is not very good. I was able to access my email though. There is a grocery store in the mall to the right of the Gloucester Road tube stop entrance. I found their fruit to be very good and the price was similar to Walmart. And up the street 5 minutes there is a convenience store that sells all kinds of food that has really late hours. I believe it is called Tesco. The Red Leicester cheese there is excellent. Far better than any cheddar I've had here in the states. So make good use of those in room refrigerators. The pluses are the staff for the most part are very friendly. The little English guy with glasses seemed a bit off putting. The continental breakfast that is served in the mornings in their dining room is very good. I was served hot toast and coffee by the young oriental girls working there. Nice smiles and cute. The toast was the best I have ever had with a choice of jelly and preserves. The fruit that was cut was cantaloupe and honey dew melon. Coming from the states I expected it to be unripe and pretty much inedible. Boy was i surprised. It was excellent . Cereal and juices are also available at the bar. There is really no need to spend any money for breakfast. It was so good. A perfect way to start the day. And all of this on linen table clothes. A little more about the room. We had a single bed and a double bed in our room. My bed seemed to sleep nicely. It was a bit warm in the room but I put that up to my roommate who set the thermostat.. You might need to be a bit agile in getting in the tube for a shower. There is a bit of a step into the tube. So if you are a little bit iffy in the mobility department you may have trouble. But I am told that they don't know how to do showers in England so you may have this issue elsewhere. Our companions who were in room 106 said that their water was not hot. I did not get a full understanding of the exact nature of this problem. Let me recommend the Van Gogh exhibition at the Royal Academy of Art. for those that will be in London before April 17th. I think that's when it ends. It was amazing. I was told it would be an hour and a half wait to get in and I went on a Friday night about 6:00 and waited only 5 minutes Pay the extra few pounds and do the audio tour. The highlight of my trip! That and the wonderful people! Let me say that London is a wonderful place that was made even better by my stay at the Montana Hotel .I will be staying there if I get back that way.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, basic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: ALBinWDC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Montana Hotel for 3 nights in February 2010. The property was as described by most previous reviewers—good—friendly, accommodating staff; “thisclose” proximity to convenience stores, eateries; direct Heathrow Tube access; etc. The mini fridge in every room sealed the deal for me. There’s even a small Info/Tourist Center across the street and a laundromat 2 blocks away. (Also the #49 bus on Gloucester goes to the fabulous Westfield London shopping mall @15 min away.) My room 205 (a triple) was about the size of a standard US hotel room. Though it overlooked busy Gloucester Rd, I wasn’t bothered by street noise (but then the windows were shut as it was wintertime). The hallways were quiet, too. My only complaint was that the room didn't get warm enough for me. But that’s me (I’m always cold). The heating system worked but the output was weak. Also, be aware that the Montana offers a few rooms w/o en suite bathrooms. I unknowingly booked such a room going for the lowest rate and maybe I didn’t read carefully enough when I reserved online. Thankfully a complete room was available and the front desk quickly reassigned me--at a higher rate of course, but not overly so. Oh, the £1 Internet station in the lobby was virtually useless— it offered limited access and it froze a lot during the 20-minute session.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for London”
Reviews.Author: Rosie_the_Riveter
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights here on a business trip. Although the room wasn't ready when I arrived the staff were very friendly and offered luggage storage. The room was fine, comfortable if a bit overheated (but I've yet to come across a UK hotel that isn't too warm). The location is excellent with a tube station very nearby and Kensington in walking distance. I didn't eat there so can't comment on the food but I had a comfortable stay and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Irishshin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a shopping trip to London and it is a great hotel. Gloucester Tube station is a couple of minutes walk away. There are bars and restaurants and also two supermarkets close by. The staff at the hotel were great, always someone friendly at reception to answer any queries we had. There were 5 of us staying in the same room, we had 3 single beds and a double. The room was really big. Bathroom was a bit small but it was fine. Shower was always hot. Mini fridge available in the room for anything you wanted to buy. And the TV was wall mounted and had lots of channels. We had no problems with noise. We did find the room very hot! I would definitely stay at this hotel again. And would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Montana...Perfect Elegance.”
Reviews.Author: Luxe-Traveller-SB
Reviews.Content: For a anniversary gift to my wife to London we decided to stay at the Montana Hotel, Kensington. The Montana was chosen on recommendation from a work colleague. And was perfect in every way. The location was perfect. Bang in the heart of Kensington and Knightsbridge with all the convenience to shopping, bars and what london has to offer. The hotal itself is on Gloucester Road and opposite Gloucester tube station so very ideal for quick train ride to all sites of London and a short walk to Kensington Palace and Gardens. As soon as we arrived it looked exactly like the website photographs and the staff were very friendly and welcoming. The rooms are very adequate for a short stay, simple but elegant. I requested a bottle of champagne to be placed in the room before i arrived, i had explained to reception it was my first anniversary. With my surprise there were also complimentary box of chocolates and a rose placed on the bed, of course i took all the credit when my wife asked ( but thanks guys for the extras). The hotel has an indian restaurant which also serves breakfast and is very convenient to have a quick breakfast before you go out and explore. When we asked the reception for directions and places to go they were very helpful and even arranged a couple of excursions for us whist we were out. Overall a fantastic hotel and very accessible with a fantastic location. Keep it up Montana.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a let-down”
Reviews.Author: Groundhopper
Reviews.Content: The location was suberb being just 100 metres from Gloucester Road tube station. But sadly I was quite let down by the service in the reception. The guy I encounted seemed quite annoyed that someone was disturbing him while he was surfing on the internet. The room was okay in size, but the shower had almost no pressure at all!! I was also quite disappointed that I only got a small bar of soap!! No shampoo whatsoever. I will not return to this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'll def be going back!!”
Reviews.Author: 2extreme
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel recently with a few friends and I was pleasantly surpised by how much I appreciated the kindness the staff showed us right from entering the door. Its amazing what a diference friendly staff can make to your holiday. The rooms were more than satisfactory, comfortable with good house keeping facilities and flat screen to keep you company in your night ins! The hotel has a restaurant which served lovely food - and the great thing about it was that the menu was completely reasonably priced. The hotel had good information on the tourist hot spots and were able to provide more than enough tips and suggestions for our break. They even arranged transport services for us which can take away a lot of the un wanted stress. The hotel itself was situated in a location that was lively and had a lot to offer with a closeby tube stn to get around london. I would def recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not as promised”
Reviews.Author: JimfromAus
Reviews.Content: As an Australian traveling to London for the first time I wanted to experience good service from a good looking hotel. The website had me sold, free Internet, free pay tv, nice looking rooms and Ironing board all were nice attractions. The staff billed our credit card for the full stay on our arrival, I was immidatley suspicious. We were told our room was on the first floor and found it behind the reception desk. The window showed a view of a service ally, accompanied with a loud leaky pipe. The door didn't even open fully, making the process of getting our suitcases into the room tedious. The promised ironing facilities were nowhere to be seen and the tv was charged by the movie. The bathroom was small but manageable however we were only given one towel each and a bar of soap. There was a glass in the bathroom also which was never replaced nor washed, not exactly "Deluxe." The few good things about the hotel were the location, being so close to Gloucester RD station was a happy bonus that made travel to everywere simple. The other convenience was the attached Restaurant "Light Of India" which was overpriced however had great food and, when compared to the unhelpful hotel staff, were a godsent. Liked: The location (Can't be beaten) and attached restaraunt. Disliked: The room, the hotel staff, the promises made on the website and the lack of service for price. The only reason why this hotel would be considered bad is the price, all you are paying for is the location, with a lot of other places to stay in the area its not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: oasisCanada
Reviews.Content: I have travelled extensively and have slept in tents in Africa, huts in Vietnam and superb lodgings in Nepal but this Hotel from the moment we entered was a massive failure. The first room was right behind the front desk area adjacent to the roof mounted air conditioner. The second room had 3 single beds in it but at least it was off the ground floor.Service at the desk was non existent. When I tried to get clarity as to where we were precisely on the map the desk person continued to say "you are here" and did not look or point anyhting out on the map but simply surveyed the surroundings.We were booked to stay there for 3 nights,checked out after the first and moved to the nearby Crowne Plaza...excellent hotel. Went back to the Hotel Montana as I had left a leather portfolio case there the day before.The person said if they had found anything,they would have thrown it out. Unbelievable! I asked him if the housecleaners had found a gold watch would they have thrown that out also. Apparently they throw everything out which is extremely hard to believe. Would not call housecleaner because it was past 5pm regardless of the fact we were leaving London the next morning. Absolutely devoid of service and the rooms were bare bones.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - Advise all my friends to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Olive05
Reviews.Content: From the moment me partner and i walked into the hotel, we were made to feel very welcome. It was our first visit to the Montana Hotel, and I just wish we would have found it sooner. The staffs are so warm and helpful, I never get this much of a personal touch at 4-5 star hotels. We were shown to our rooms, which satisfactorily cosy and had everything as expected. We also had access to a selection of videos on the TV. When we were looking to plan an evening out, the very helpful and delightful receptionist, planned and suggested wonderful places, and made to so easy for us. We were ordered a car, and the whole evening was wonderful. The hotel is at the centre of everything, with all places at a near by distance, you will never not have anything to do or see. The nearest tube is just across the road, and theatres, museums etc are so close. It didn't just stop there. We were completely made to feel at home, and also made some friends there with other guests, that said they had been coming there for years. The hotel has a restaurant inside, that serves the most exquisite Indian food that had us going back for more, night after night. All in all I will definitely be going back here, as the warmness, staff and service of this hotel is like no other.

Reviews.Title: “Rude reception at Montana Hotel”
Reviews.Author: D77
Reviews.Content: I was attracted to Montana by the location and the pricing, however, i was totally put off by the rudeness of the people manning the reception, especially this person by the name of Chris. He totally snubbed his nose at me when i asked for the cheapest rate at the hotel, as i was alone and did not need luxury, being alot out of the hotel anyway. When i first enquired, they quoted me a price and i indicated my interest. I had to then leave in a hurry to attend to some things. Within an hour, when i returned and was prepared to place a deposit for my booking, i was informed that the price earlier quoted was no longer available as the room they were quoting me for had been taken up! From the way things were handled, i had difficulty believing that that was the truth. It was also the way Chris and his colleague were playing "good guy, bad guy", Having said that, however, i have to say that i really liked the staff who served at the restaurants. They were very friendly and attentive to my needs, and sensitive to my desires. It was such a saving grace for this hotel. The rooms were ok. Very small, though, but liveable if you are going to be mostly out and just come back to rest. Certainly, polite reception staff would have changed the whole impression for this hotel as they are the first persons that guests see. Oh well ...!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: JMML18
Reviews.Content: Thinking this would be a great place to take my mother for a girly weekend the website certainly sold it - I learned a big lesson- just pay more. The hallway smelled like a toilet in a student flat that may have been due to the bathrooms that are randomly placed around the hotel. We had to get moved as we were on the 4th floor the first night and when I got up to have a shower was told the water pressure was bad and if I waited an hour or so it would be better- really they said that. The en suite in the first room was smaller than my own ensuite and decorated as the rest of the hotel was in a classic 80s style - that was made in the 80s. It was bismal. The best part was upon arrive there was a sign in the window offering rooms for £55. I am sure you can do much worse in London but this was pretty disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Does not deserve a 4 star rating.More like a 2 star.”
Reviews.Author: bapton
Reviews.Content: The website made the hotel look quite impressive and £95 for a room with continental breakfast seemed like a good deal. However,on our arrival we were shown to a room just behind reception which was dark,overheated and lacking in amenities.There were no toiletries apart from a couple of small bars of soap,no ironing board and iron(although the website states that every room has one),no mini bar,no hot drink making facilities and,nowhere to hang a towel in the bathroom. There was also some sort of extractor fan outside the window which came on and off intermittently all night.Obviously my request for a quiet room was totally ignored! I complained about the room but was told the hotel was full (although the breakfast room the following day did not seem overcrowded). The breakfast was poor - stewed coffee,a few pices of toast(white bead only),jam,juices,cereals and tinned fruit. However,on a plus note the staff were very attentive. I deliberately picked a 4 star hotel as I thought we would get good accomodation but this was a rip-off. The only plus side was that ir was a couple of minutes walk from the tube. My advice is - avoid at all costs. There are other hotels in the area which may be more expensive but probably worth paying a bit more to get a decent room.

Reviews.Title: “Better value elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: docstw
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9 nights recently, and would advise you to look around for better value. The location is good, being moments walk from the underground, but so are hundreds of better hotels in London. The elevator was too small for two people and our luggage, the air conditioning was so loud that we had to wear ear plugs (but were told it was 'normal' and that we must be light sleepers...we're not) and the room was so small you could not walk side by side between the bed and dresser. The breakfast was okay, considering they provided some cut fruit with their cereal and toast, but heavy on the carbs and no protein (e.g. no eggs or yoghurt or cheese unless you bought from the regular menu). Love London, not this hotel and I've travelled far and wide and stayed in quite a few.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: Touristonvacation
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home from the most wonderful visit to London. I sincerely believe this vacation was enhanced by our choice of hotel. I was looking for a small hotel as I am getting tired of the larger-than-life, impersonal, anonymous hotels. The elevator was small but I was happy that there was one! The whole point of the trip was to see London and by staying somewhere affordable I was able to do everything that I wanted to. I read reviews here before I left and I have to admit I was a bit nervous about staying at the Montana. This hotel more than exceeded my expectations. The staff was friendly and knowledgable about their city. They were friendly first thing in the morning at breakfast and inquired about our day when we returned to the hotel. As we were two ladies travelling alone I felt a bit more comfortable knowing that someone in this large city had an idea what I was doing. Don't get me wrong - they weren't being nosy, just friendly. When asked, they offered suggestions about whether it would be better to take the tube or bus at a particular time of day i.e. rush hour, where to buy items that I was looking for, etc. Our room was very clean. It was small but it was all we needed. I loved the layout. It was a narrow room with the ends of the single beds facing each other. The bathroom was a good size with a full-size tub and shower. The tub was bigger than our tubs at home and we enjoyed a soak in it every night after returning from out sightseeing. When we needed more towels I just phoned the desk and they were brought to us right away. Across the street is a major grocery store with a good, fresh selection of fruits and vegetables, cooked chickens, pre-made sandwiches, dairy, etc. As our room had a fridge we were able to save a bit of money by buying our supper at the grocery store. There was even enough money left over at the end of the week that we were able to see another play in the west end. The hotel is across the street from the tube (subway) and less than a 10 minute walk to a bus stop. It's also within walking distance of Harrod's but you may need to take a bus back with all of your purchases. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone. It's not too fancy, but it was exactly what we were looking for. Keep in mind that if you are friendly and nice to people they will reflect that back to you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel - great value!”
Reviews.Author: luvtutravel_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montana Hotel in London in June 2008, LOVED IT! The value is terrific for London Hotels. The location is fantastic, you are close to the "tube" to bus routes and there are many stores, banks, etc. right in the same block of the hotel. We couldn't have asked for a better location. The rooms are small, but they are your typical European style rooms, they were clean, comfy and suited our needs well. The staff were friendly and helpful. People complain about the breakfast but we found the breakfast just fine. There was cold cereal, toast, tea, coffee and juice. If you want a larger breakfast you can order it from their menu. What more do you need? We will definitely stay at the Montana Hotel the next time we are in London. It's a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in nice part of London”
Reviews.Author: White-family
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at the Montana while attending a concert at the Royal Albert Hall. Having booked it online at £90.00 including breakfast I was wondering what sort of accommodation we would get, but we got a nicely decorated, clean, albeit small room with decent shower room en suite, flat screen TV, safe, air conditioning (it was 31 deg. in London at the time) - a real bargain for Kensington. The staff are friendly, breakfast good - you could order eggs etc. at extra cost - but the toast,cereals, juice and coffee were fine for us. There was also fresh fruit on offer but I'm not sure if it was included in our package. This area of London is really nice, safe, close to all amenities (banks, Waitrose, Tesco, Starbucks, Pret A Manger etc.), 2 decent English pubs, loads of restaurants, and only a 10-15 minute walk to the Royal Albert Hall. Gloucester Road tube is just adjacent. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: renoj
Reviews.Content: We caught the tube from Heathrow in the very early hours of the morning, around 12.30, which I would not reccomend doing especially families with lots of luggage. It was quite stressful after a long haul flight, and my daughter left one of her bags behind on the tube. Having said that, it is a cheap and convenient way to get to the hotel as the station is literally righty accross the road from the hotel. As we had lots of luggage, and the lift was so small only one of us could go up at a time, we thought they might give us a hand witht he luggage, but maybe there was only limited staff at that time of the night. We had a quad room (2 singles and a double) which was adequate although not a lot of space to put our luggage. The bathroom was a lot smaller than we were used to in Australia, but it did the job. Our room was overlooking Gloucester Road which was lovely. The only thing i didnt like was that the windows didnt open, which gave the room a stuffy feeling, but im sure that wouldnt matter at any other time of the year, because we were lucky enough to have beautiful, almost hot weather for our entire stay. The location is excellent with a short walk to Kensington High Street and down the other end restaurants, post office, tesco's, burger king, starbucks, etc. Quite a lively area, well into the night but wasn't disturbing to us. A very nice walk to Hyde park down Cromwell Road and close to the Natural History Museum, and Harrods. Breakfast was the highlight of the hotel for us, because we really enjoyed the cereal and toast, because we didnt feel like anything more. Peter the waiter made our breakfast enjoyablewith his great service, and he gave us reccomendations on many different attractions around the city. Overall we have great memories of staying at the Montana, and would reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: TexasJojo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here April 20-26, 2009. Even though I arrived earlier than the posted check-in time, they had my room ready and waiting for me. And what a pleasant surprise of a room it was! The last couple of times I've stayed in London, I was at another hotel in the same area where I was put in a dark, cramped, grimy room barely big enough for one single bed. But at the Montana, my room (number 311) was clean and bright, and spacious. The bathroom was small, but not uncomfortably so. I requested a tub, and it was large, with plenty of space for soaps and shampoos. As mentioned in previous reviews, this hotel does not provide shampoo, which is not an issue with me as I prefer my own brand. They did provide a small bar of soap and two towels. The soap and towels were replaced daily. There is a Boots and grocery store in the tube station shopping arcade across the street, where you can buy anything else you need. Another nice touch was the mirrored medicine cabinet and glass-holder built into the wall. There room had its own thermostat control, and the A/C worked very well. The room had a queen and a single bed, a large window overlooking a charming residential street behind the hotel, and more drawers and electrical outlets than I could use. The plugs are British-style only, so you'll need adapters if you're from another country. I bought a couple inexpensive ones at Boots. There was also a good-sized wardrobe, where the room safe was tucked away. I bought soda and pre-made sandwiches, and fruit from the nearby grocery stores, and kept them in the mini-fridge. This left me more money for shows and other attractions! The elevator is indeed small, but large enough for my friend and I to go up together with our (carry-on sized) bags. My first night there, I discovered that the bathtub drain was broken. I called it in the next morning, and the maintenance was there within the hour. He replaced the entire drain unit and it was perfect for the rest of my stay. He, and the rest of the staff, were very polite and friendly. As others have noted, the location of this hotel can't be beat. The Gloucester Road station is right across the street. Don't forget to look BOTH ways, and watch out for vehicles turning left around the corner from Gloucester Road onto Cromwell Road - they have the right of way, even on red! It's a straight shot from Heathrow airport on the Piccadilly line (both ways took me less than 30 minutes). The station is also served by Circle and District lines. The wide-screen TV was really nice, especially as it came with FREE music and movies on demand. Loved it. There was also a good variety of channels available, including the various BBC stations, ITV, Channel 5, and a few other cable choices. The TV also had a clock and wake-up alarm built into it, which you set with the remote control. The man at the front desk gave me a slip of paper with the wifi network key so I could use the free Internet. You have to set your connection to key index 2, which I suspect flummoxes some guests ... especially those with Macs using OSX, as it only supports key index 1! However, I was using a netbook with Windows XP and got hooked up without any problems. The connection was on the slow side, but perfectly adequate for checking e-mail and looking up addresses on Google maps. Basically, this hotel had everything I was hoping to find (great location, wifi, mini-fridge, A/C, safe, tub) and more! I'm very much looking forward to staying here again, next time I visit London.

Reviews.Title: “10 days in English Paradise”
Reviews.Author: beachlover64
Reviews.Content: We 4 ladies (2 18 and 21 and 2 mid 40"s) and stayed at the Montana Hotel in Kensington. It was very good overall. Right across from a tube station(Gloucester rd.) with 2 grocerystores nearby and 2 Starbucks and a 5 minute walk to a laundrymat.Tha front desk staff were friendly and helpful.Our room was the small narrow one pictured on one ladies's previous post but it was fine for my daughter and I as the bathroom was quite large. Yes the elevator was small (me and my big bag only fit in it at one time) but we were on the second floor so walked up all the time.the hotel is only a 7 minute walk to Kensington Palace, Gardens and plenty of teen girl shopping nearby!! the breakfast was just toast and cereal and juice,tea etc but unlimited and good enough several mornings for us. We did 2 Golden bust tours from the hotel and were very happy with both the guides and the meals included. We arrived FRiday April 17 in the rain, then had perfect spring weather for the rest of the 10 days.On the Tuesday we travelled by train to Buxton to visit Chatsworth on the Wednesday, however, when we arrived at the Buckingham Hotel with nothing to do at 2 p.m. on Tuesday the front desk receptionist suggested a climb past the Poole caverns to something called Solomon's Temple. It was so worth it and my 18 year old daughter called this the best part of her entire trip. A small fort set high in with peak district surrounding you with magnificent views. Chatsworth was beautiful my personal favourite of the trip, a must see for all romantic English lovers.WE took the Eurostar to Paris on the Friday, the train was fine the Metro dirty and smelly, the Eiffel tower up the stairs was lovely though tiring ,walked from there to the Musee D'Orsay then the Louvre the on to the Notre Dame and back the same day to LOndon, finishing with high tea at the Orangery at Kensington Palace. The trip overall was wonderful and I cannot wait to go again and see the things I only got to glimpse at.

Reviews.Title: “Positively surprised”
Reviews.Author: NSPZealand
Reviews.Content: Surprised after having read some of the reviews. We were 7 having ordered 2 double rooms and a triple room. The triple room was very fine with good space - only did we have the smallest bathroom! The staff were friendly and immediately found another room instead of the basement room they had given us as one of the double rooms.
