Also very helpful with our luggage because of problems with the lift. Good service at breakfast, so we had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, but more than adequate”
Reviews.Author: ElvishBadgerQueen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights, for a theatre/city break. I must say, the location is excellent, the nearest tube station is just over the road, plus plenty of amenities too. The rooms were clean, but not exactly roomy. For that price-range I can't imagine you would get anything bigger in central London though. The en-suite shower room was tiny!! It was actually amazing that they managed to fit a toilet, tiny sink and shower cubicle in such a small space! One thing they didn't manage to fit in was a hand towel. Decor was abit dated, but the flatscreen TV with freeview was pretty cool. Breakfast is advertised as continental, but I'm not sure if I'd class cereal and toast as continental? Chuck in a few pastries!! Cooked brekkie was available at an extra cost. Didn't visit the hotel bar, but did visit the Indian restaurant which was quite nice. 10% discount for hotel guests. Overall, it did the job for us. We were out from straight after breakfast each day and didn't return til very late, so for a place to rest your head, it was fine. Not sure I'd have wanted to stay there for that much longer though!! Oh, one other thing, the wi-fi connection doesn't work. My laptop could pick up the signal, but it wouldn't connect to the net, wherever I tried, and at various times. That was my only real quibble about the place.

Reviews.Title: “You have better hotel choices in the same vicinity! Avoid this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BuenosAiresFer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not recommendable based on different factors, but the first and most important, the lack of service attitude the front desk personnel provides. We had to make a trip to the airport on a Sunday early morning (the tube wasn't working by that time) and the front desk personnel suggested taking a taxi (50 pounds) or making the trip by WALK. After asking the same question to the nearby Underground personnel, they suggested we take a bus (8 blocks from the Hotel) into Heathrow (2 pounds trip) - Unbelievable!! The first night, we asked to the same front desk personnel where to go out for a drink, to a typical London bar... and they suggested to stay in since they had a bar (2 tables, 4 chairs, one small TV)... it really looked like they were making fun of us. Obviously, after taking a few walk, we found an incredible place (big bar) just in front of the tube station. In the same vicinity (5 blocks around the Gloucester Underground station) you have so many Hotels to choose from: I hardly recommend the Gloucester Millenium Hotel: incredible reception and rooms, amazing staff, and just 10 more pounds a night out of the Montana. We had to stay for a single night in another trip into the city, and it was such a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: muskokaguys
Reviews.Content: Love The Montana Kensington. This is the second year in a row that we have stayed here. Last year the bathroom was tiny so we asked for a larger one and got one on the first floor. The rooms are fairly spacious and very clean, cleaning is done daily and early. The room was at the back of the hotel and was very quiet. We were there January 8th to Jan 15th 2009 and London was VERY COLD, however the room was always warm and you can adjust the heat accordingly. The bathroom was spacious with a bath/shower combo. Always plenty of hot water and good pressure. The front desk personnel are fabulous. The act as your personal agent helping with restaurant confirmations or cancellations, directions, getting on the VIP list for nightclubs etc. Tha staff are very friendly and pesonable(both visits) and all the main staff are the same as last year. The location is amazing, the tube is across the street and Harrods etc and the Museums are 5 minutes away. Try Racine restaurant on Old Brompton Street and Murano(Gordon Ramseys latest) in Mayfair.The Indian restaurant in the Hotel is very good and is quite busy at time so prepare ahead-guests also receive 10% off the bill. We hate preaching to people but cordiallity begets cordiality-some people should adhere to this principle when travelling!! Nuff said We highly recommend this Hotel. Muskoka Guys

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, cheerful and adequate”
Reviews.Author: sargee3
Reviews.Content: Just wanted a real cheap, one night stay, in order to see a show at the Albert Hall. Location excellent for Albert Hall, museums, Hyde Park, Harrods/shops and tube. Hotel looked very pleasant on first sight and received a very friendly greeting. An Indian Restaurant is part of the Hotel and the smell carried up the stairs, but not into our room fortunately. The room was adequate for the great price. No welcome tray in the room but hair dryer, good size tv with lots of channels and small safe. Bathroom was just ok, in need of renovations, a little rough round the edges, ie new silicon needed around the shower and the toilet roll holder was falling off the wall and when sat on the loo, your knees were scrunched up against the hand basin, but again for the price, adequate. The double bed and pillows were comfy enough but the sheets were very sparce and we were fighting for them in the night - needed bigger sheets! Had breakfast in the morning as included in the price - again very basic but as expected for the price. Cereals, juice, toast and tea/coffee. Presume you could have paid for a better breakfast but it did us fine. Would recommend for a one or possibly 2 night stay, but no more. Perfectly adequate for the price, but perfectly adequate to some may not be to others, so rather difficult to say. Overall, 7/10.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: cdar
Reviews.Content: Just back from a wonderful 11 day stay over Christmas and New Year's. We loved the Montana. The front desk staff, restaurant staff, housekeeping were all friendly and helpful. Its a great location; we felt very safe there. From previous reviews we knew the hotel was an older budget property; which it was. I found it charming and would stay there again. Three elevator trips to our rooms on the 3rd floor. Our teenagers had a small room with two tandem twin beds; a huge bathroom with tub & shower facing the street. Some traffic noise was heard at night. Our room was acros the hall. a little more space, double bed, and the tinest bathroom, shower only, I have ever seen. A good sized and quality towel with a little bar of soap (no shampoo etc) was left for each person on the bed. I called the fron desk for extra towels and a tea tray. Each day extra towels were left and the tea tray refilled. Breakfast hours are short and later on Sundays and bank holidays. Continental breakfast included coffee, tea or hot chocolate; two slices of toast, two cereal choices, milk, juice and water (maybe tap, if you order water at a restaurant in London or Paris, they bring you an expensive 500ml/16oz water bottle). If not included with your room this was less than 5 pounds (and when you see the price of coffee and size elsewhere, it might seem like a bargain). There are sit down restaurants, Starbucks, Burger King across the street. Each room had a fridge and we kept them stocked from the Waitrose grocery store. Boots (drugstore) also had a decent combo price on a pre-made sandwich/drink/snack. If you have any food allergies or a picky eater I suggest taking a picnic lunch for out of town trips as we found it was tricky for find food for one of our children. The underground is diagonally across the street; Picadilly, Circle, and District lines. Picadilly is quite deep, you will have 30 steps before accessing an elevator to bring you to street level. Circle and District have 36 steps to the street. Very convenient for transport from Heathrow or the trains. Choose an Oster Card or Travel Card (read London Tube reviews on TripAdvisor). We purchased Hop On Hop Off bus vouchers from the hotel. A stop was barely a half block away. I had purchased London Pass vouchers from Canada. It was NOT a good value for us; seeing more than 3 attractions in a day was too ambitious. Had to exchange the voucher in London for the pass - short hours for pick up. The London Pass may save you time in line-ups to purchase separate admissions; reseach if the Hop On Hop Off people let you skip queus as they sell tickets at their stops that are close to attractions. Good maps for when you exit the underground would be helpful. You can be pushed, shoved, stepped on, and rolled over on by luggage or strollers. Its hard to get your bearings as street signs can be on a fence, the building, or nowhere to be found; when you're being swept along by crowds. Not all areas where crowded; just be prepared. Harrods is one of the crowded areas, in the store itself! a 20 minute walk or a quick underground trip. Keep in mind that London prices for food and hotels are easily double to what you would pay in North Amercia. We were very happy with The Montana and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: mfilcol
Reviews.Content: Very bad hotel. We stayed in a basement room.Very bad,Very very cold (air condition works very bad and with noise) Room not very clean.Only 1 towel. Staff unpleasant.(breakfast included) The only good thing is the location near the tube station. I don´t know how the other rooms are ,but the basement floor are terrible. Not recommended

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you can”
Reviews.Author: Therooster
Reviews.Content: London is a tough city to get good value for a hotel room. But at the Montana they're not even trying. I spent a hundred pounds a night for one of the worst hospitality experiences I have ever had. Just terrible value. So much is wrong with this place I don't even know where to start. Perhaps I should start with the good bits, as it's easier since there are only two: free wireless internet access and location. The location is very good, near the tube station, cafes, shops etc in a trendy part of town. Granted though, this may not be for everyone. While it may be good for people doing business in the area or even in central London, tourists may prefer to stay somwhere else closer to the main sights. But overall, I don't think you can fault this location. Now on the bad bits. The room is as warm and welcoming as guantanamo bay. It's old, tired, slightly smelly and extremely basic. The bathrrom was designed for very tiny people, the shower is pokey and the water pressure is so so. For 100 pounds all I got was some old soap by the way, so remember to bring everything else. The lift is small and slow and always stinks of something different (if it's not tobacco it's garlic or farts - it's just revolting). Staff at reception looks bored and uninspired. I asked for an iron and they said they were all out; didn't even volunteer to let me know when one was back. They always want your key when you leave the hotel, which I find annoying and unsafe. Breakfast entails tea or coffee, corn flakes, and four burnt slices of toast. For some extra money you could order something else but I didn't dare! The restaurant area looked very unwelcoming, and the table cloths looked like they've been there since world war 2. Anyway, I could go on forever. In frankness, I didn't find this a revolting experience (I didn't see cockroaches or filth, for example) but it's certainly below average. And for 100 pounds a night I think you can expect a little bit better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to sleep in a great location...”
Reviews.Author: PDCE-85
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to the Montana Hotel, which in itself, should indicate that we think this is an excellent place to stay! The location is served by the Picadilly tube line, which travels west to Heathrow airport and northeast right into the center of town. Short answer, you're hard pressed to find a better location, especially if you are coming and going by air. The hotel itself is relatively simple, with modest rooms with OK beds. In three visits, we have never had any trouble with check-in or cleanliness of the room. Sometimes the staff has been more friendly than others, but never inattentive. This is NOT a luxury hotel. Views from the windows consist mainly of rooftops and urban landscape, and the elevator is small and a bit creepy, which has inspired us to get a bit more exercise on the stairs. But the hotel is located in a safe neighborhood with a small shopping center right across the street which has proven helpful for a few groceries and sundries as needs have arisen. It might be worth mentioning that while breakfast is included, this does NOT imply the full English breakfast, but instead, a very limited offering of cereal and toast. You can upgrade, for a price, but you might do better to make your way across the street to Garfunkel's. (I'm a bit partial to the waffles with fruit topping!) London is an expensive place to visit, espescially with a devalued dollar. Despite an earlier report to the contrary, we find the Montana Hotel to be a good value, and a safe, clean place to sleep, well situated to exploring the city of London. I suspect we will visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Not at the price”
Reviews.Author: cherubino
Reviews.Content: I was in London on business, so this hotel was booked by the company I was working for. The location is good for getting into Central London (just over the road from Gloucester Road tube), and there are a good number of shops/restaurants nearby. I had a very large room (2 double beds and a single!) on the Ground Floor behind the Reception. My colleagues on higher floors had much smaller rooms. There was also a desk and separate writing table and a large LCD TV. The bedroom had obviously been refurbished fairly recently, and the sheets and bedding were very clean. The bathroom was not of the same standard. For example, the bath panel was full of holes and cracks (some of which had been repaired with tape that had obviously peeled off years ago), the cabinet was beginning to fall apart, the toilet was very difficult to flush as the internal mechanism needs attention etc etc. However, the accommodation was clean, and the staff were pleasant. Another worry was that the catches on the windows were either very wobbly, or didn't work at all. I don't think this is acceptable in any standard of hotel, and would be interested to see how my insurance company viewed it if I made a claim. The Bar looked pleasant enough, but was dominated by the TV that always appeared to be on. I would not choose to stay here if I had to pay for myself, as I feel the Corus Hyde Park is much better value, although a few pounds extra. My company paid £90/night including Full English Breakfast and En Suite.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff Made This a "Class A" Experience”
Reviews.Author: NHYankee
Reviews.Content: We had booked a different hotel in London through a travel agency and on arrival discovered it was not up to advertised standards. In an exhausted and anxious state we walked down the street to learn what else was available and just happened upon The Montana Hotel. Here we were warmly received and the entire staff went out of their way to accommodate us, despite fairly solid bookings, making our stay a relaxing and enjoyable one. This small, charming hotel is located within easy walking distance from the Gloucester Road Underground Station with small restaurants, shops and several major museums nearby. Thus we had easy access to public transit for travel about the city as well as places to visit on foot such as the Victoria and Albert Museum, Science Museum and Museum of Natural History. Our rooms were aesthetically attractive with up to date conveniences including internet access, flat screen TV with movie/music choices, small fridge, safe box , air conditioning and adequate closet and storage spaces. Our accommodations were kept exceptionally clean and comfortable by the housekeeping staff. Room prices include a continental breakfast of cereal, toast & jam plus beverages with options for more extensive breakfasts. Meals are served in an attractive dining room which in the eveinings caters to hotel guests as well as others offering delicious Indian cuisine. There is also a small lounge and bar just off the hotel foyer, with a friendly and wonderfully funny bar keep. Though the hotel was almost fully booked when we walked through their doors, the staff went out of their way to find us rooms for that first evening and then, to enable us to depart for our scheduled activities early the next day, moved our luggage to different rooms for the remainder of our stay. The kindness and generosity of the staff cannot be elaborated on enough, from how the day clerk we first met responded to our situation with sympathy while making our stay possible, to the night clerk whom we came to consider as a wonderful new friend. He answered many questions, helping us learn about the city and use the public transit system with ease. At the end of our stay he even carried our bags to the Underground platform we needed for our return trip to Heathrow. If a giant establishment with swimming pools and grand ball rooms is what you want then look elsewhere. But if an attractive, comfortable hotel where you will feel completely safe and cared for by wonderful people whose service goes beyond expectations suits your needs, then the Montana Hotel is the place to stay. Thank you all at The Montana from the bottom of our hearts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: RambleTamble
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montana whilst on a recent trip to the Albert Hall. The location is excellent, opposite Gloucester Road tube with pubs and cafes nearby. It is particularly good for London museums and the Albert Hall and Hyde Park. The hotel itself was clean and rooms are advertised as available from 11.00 am although we had to wait 10 minutes when we arrived at 1.00pm as the maid was still in the room but not a problem as we popped into the Stanthorpe Arms pub for a quick pint. There was no tea tray but this was delivered as soon as we rang down to reception. The room was tidy and clean with air con and flat screen tv. Reception and breakfast service was efficient and overall represented good value for money. Would recomend staying here if visitng the Kensington area of London.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: USA_4_LIFE
Reviews.Content: We went to London for a quick weekend getaway. We arrived on Saturday morning and checkout on Monday. This hotel is perfect for what we wanted. It was clean, small, and in a great location. Sure the elevator is small, and the bathroom is the same size, but if you want luxury, you would not be looking in this price range anyway! Book this hotel for a good kick off point, and if you only plan on sleeping there, you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Hague514
Reviews.Content: Had checked out of our booked hotel as it was awful. Walked down street and tried others in vicinity (Holiday Inn etc.) which were expensive and full. Entered Montana who had a room free and even let us check it out before booking considering our last hotel. Room was clean, spacious and had everything we would expect from a good 3 star hotel. Best of all was room rate which was approx. 1/2 cost of other local hotels. Staff very helpful and even on site indian restaurant which served very good food. I would more than recommend this hotel and will use it for all future stays in London. Convenient for Earls Court exhibition centre and museums with Tube station almost directly opposite.

Reviews.Title: “return visit”
Reviews.Author: freddyVancouver
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from our second visit to the Montana in two years. The rooms have been nicely recarpeted and repapered so all looks new and clean. We are very happy with the value and service we get from this hotel. We were given a room with a double and a twin bed and a spacious bathroom. The room was on the back side off the street so very quiet at night even with the windows open. The location can't be beat, Waitrose, Boots, tube station, Stanhope Arms, Starbucks, etc. all in a block. The staff were helpful, even sending the maintenance man up to repair a handle broken on one of our bags. We will certainly come here again .

Reviews.Title: “Nice base”
Reviews.Author: nige9359
Reviews.Content: First impressions shouldn't be everything, but they do tend to colour your view for the rest of a trip. To be in the hotel's reception just over a minute after leaving the tube station was a big bonus, as are the automatic doors as you walk up the steps to the hotel. As we entered, the receptionist jumped up from his seat in the loungs and was extremely helpful, especially as he had to find our booking as we'd only booked online 2 hours earlier and I couldn't recall which agency I'd booked through and I hadn't printed a confirmation due to time constraints. He was cheerful throughout and guessed the reason we were at the hotel (concert at Albert Hall) - I guess they had a few in for that and that made it busier than a normal sunday evening. The lift to the second floor is not for the claustrophobic, it says you can get 4 people in it, I wouldn't want to try it, it's not much different in size to an old style UK telephone box. The room was fine, it had both a 4ft 6 double and a single, a plasma tv but (as far as we could find) no way of making a hot drink (it had an empty fridge though) Breakfast of tea, toast, cornflakes etc was included in our £110 rate - it was served in the room that becomes an indian restaurant later in the day. It appeared that you could upgrade to full english for £5.50 a person. Location was fine, although if you had a room facing the front, I guess it could be a little noisy as it's on the junctions of Gloucester Road and Cromwell Road (one of the main routes into central London. We walked to the royal albert hall in about 15 minutes and to Sloane Square in about 25 (gently strolling both times) Harrods would be about the same as SS and the museums about the same as the RAH. Plenty of restaurants, cafes etc very close plus waitrose, boots, 2 banks, plenty of buses and of course the tube which is on circle, district and piccadilly - about 10 mins to theatreland, 4 stops to paddington if coming in from heathrow.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: traveler1990
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and thought it was very good value for money. Staff was fine (despite earlier comments on this site) and en-suite single room was also good. Nice flatscreeen tv set with internet and movie options, large bath and good bed. Breakfast was fine, location very good, and very good value for money given the fact that the area is one of the more expensive ones in London. Will definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were after”
Reviews.Author: shem_the_ween
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the Montana for one night just before Easter. We were after a good value hotel in a handy location and for £80 for a twin room it was just what we were after. The hotel is very conveniently located about two minutes walk from Gloucester Road tube station. Check in was fine and the receptionist was perfectly pleasant. Reception area links onto the bar area and was all well presented and very clean (they use some lovely air fresheners so it smelled nice too!). We had booked a twin room but found this to be a double when we got to the room (probably the only disappointment, but overall not a real issue and we found out at check out that there are twin rooms available). We had expected tea/coffee making facilities in the room which weren't there upon arrival. However (big customer service plus points for this), within a couple of minutes reception rang up to the room to say that the tea tray was on it's way up ... 30 seconds later, the tray arrived. The room was fairly recently redecorated and spotlessly clean, with plenty of wardrobe space and a fridge and big flatscreen tv too. Be prepared for the size of the bathrooms as they can only be described as bijou. But this again was spotlessly clean and the shower worked well (there's only a small bar of soap/person provided so make sure you bring your own shampoo/conditioner/shower gel). We had a room at the back of the hotel, which was great because it was nice and quiet and no road noise to contend with. The hotel also has an Indian Restaurant attached which we ate at and whilst the menu is fairly standard fare, the prices are reasonable, the service was attentive, food tasty and portion sizes good. Continental breakfast was included, which previous reviews have rated as meagre. Continental breakfast is exactly what you get: cereal, toast, juice and tea/coffee/hot chocolate. This was more than enough to get us on our way and when my mom snaffled the last sachet of marmalade, my sighs of disappointment were overheard and two more sachets were delivered to the table ... good service!! If you're looking for a good value hotel in a handy central london location for up to 3 nights stay, I would certainly recommend. Next time we head down to London, I suspect we'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent London base”
Reviews.Author: Lesley34
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Montana Hotel in London. In South Kensington area, very close to Royal Albert Halls, Kensington Gardens/Hyde Park, main museums and Harrods. Hotel very clean indeed, with modern furnishings - had a very nice quadruple room for our family. Staff very nice and helpful. "Light of India" Restaurant is part of the hotel - we had a meal there one night and it was very nice. Hotel is just across road from underground station, plenty of shops and restaurants in vicinity. Would most definitely recommend this hotel for your London holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Receptionist”
Reviews.Author: Luara
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving I was met by the rudest hotel receptionist I've ever had the displeasure of meeting. I enquired about west-end tickets which he informed me I should purchase "between 12 and 1". When I replied "between 12-1?" simply clarifying the time, he rudely retorted "yes.or you could go at 11,but you would be too early.Or you could go at 2, but you would be too late." When I discovered that all the pillows contained feathers, I returned to reception to politely ask for a normal pillow as I was allergic to feathers, to which the same receptionist rudely replied that they had none and that I should have foreseen the possibility of this situation and brought my own pillow with me. Not only would travelling long distance with a pillow in tow be extremely inconvenient, but I've stayed in a lot of hotels, including other 3 star hotels, and I have never before been denied a normal pillow, and I've never had - what I would consider a simple request, handled with such disrespect. There were several other rude and sarcastic comments made by the receptionist during the course of the stay, and I noticed that he treated other customers with the same bad attitude. Location of the hotel was excellent, but this receptionist definitely brought down the quality of the stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Receptionist.”
Reviews.Author: Jess11811
Reviews.Content: The receptionist was just rude and [--]. he was incredibly unhelpfull and anything we asked for there was an attitude along with it. i had a pleasant stay other then that rude man!

Reviews.Title: “Compact basic clean rooms - we saw a lot of them !”
Reviews.Author: tjmCork_Ireland
Reviews.Content: We found the Montana hotel a good base for a 4 day family trip, 2 adults & 3 kids (12,10,8) to London between Christmas / New Year, where we spent all day out and about in London. It is very near the underground / bus tour stop which was a big plus coming home in the evening tired from our activities. We picked the Montana as it has a family room for five, good location and good reviews. The hotel had no record of our booking on arrival at 10.30 pm, a bit alarming with 3 tired kids. In trying to fit us in for the 4 days we were shuffled through 5 rooms in total and saw at least two more. This got a bit tiring but the staff appeared to be trying to do their best. The rooms are all small but clean. The only reservation would be about rooms in the basement which appeared to have a bit of an odour. Breakfast is basic a choice of two cereals, "juice", loads of toast, tea, coffee or hot chocolate. Extras could be purchased. In summary it's a good value for money, basic, clean hotel in a nice central part of London. Just confirm your booking !

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: WLHBucks
Reviews.Content: On arrival we checked in only to be given a room with twin beds, I rang through and this was changed for a double room. The room I booked was a double deluxe, I have never seen anyhting further from the truth. The room was so small that the door hit the bed when you opened the door. It must have been 6' x6'. We had 1 bath towel each no hand towel or bathmat even though the tiled floor was extremely slippery. There were no toiletries only a guest size tablet of soap. I have stayed in many hotels but htis has to be the worst. The continental breakfast was a choice of 2 cereals and toast!!! Never again

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price.”
Reviews.Author: beattyjohn
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Montana from Sept 12 to sept 23 in 2007 and found it to be a charming place. Staff was very helpful and polite and seemed to show a genuine desire to see that we had a great stay in London. I would definately go back and would recommend this place to others. Great location too!

Reviews.Title: “Nice 'little' Hotel”
Reviews.Author: palmtree152
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Montana for 5 days while visitng my daughter who was studying in London for the summer. Hotel was in a great location, staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was small, bathroom was TINY!! But the room was immaculate and adequate for our needs. Breakfast was minimal. Many places to eat/shop/visit within walking distance. Tube is necessary in London, get an Oyster Card, worth the deposit which is returned at the end of your stay (don't forget to cash it in). ENJOY!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Base for Exploring London”
Reviews.Author: xthemullysx
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Montana twice this year and would return again if staying in London. The location of this hotel is ideal. It is very close to Gloucester Road Underground Station which is perfect if flying into Heathrow. You can get on the underground at Heathrow and go straight to Gloucester Road via the Piccadilly line which takes around 40 - 50 mins. Absolutely no hassle. Staff in the hotel are friendly and are very helpful. Rooms are clean and when I stayed in July had been refurbished. Had my own en-suite which was immaculate and room was adequately sized on both stays. Mini fridge in room was good for storing some food/drink if required. Flat Screen TV in room had Pay per View Movies and a wide selection of Music Choices. There are plenty of amenities around the hotel, including banks, bars, restaurants (including KFC and Burger King) and shops (incuding Tesco and Boots). Perfect! As before, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: timttrotter
Reviews.Content: Very good location. The rooms are quite small but clean and quiet. Only minor complaints were no tea/coffee making facility in the room and the bar stayed firmly shut.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: T2M
Reviews.Content: Average 3-star hotel for less than average price - at a great location, this makes it a hit with us. We stayed here for 4 nights in May 2007. Clean, our room was quiet, we had windows open all night. Many extras at no extra charge: continental breakfast included, free use of room safe. Location is execellent, right on the metro stop (Gloucester Road), and also the double-decker sight-seeing tour buses have a stop around the corner. There is a small selection of restaurants within walking distance (bakery, several cafes, pizzeria, pub, fish-and-chips take out...) and an internet cafe. Huge grocery store on top of the subway stop. The only turn-off, the reception on the main floor that turns into a resident bar allows smoking, so it was not pleasant at the reception in the evening, if you are not a smoker. They are renovating 1st and 2nd floor I believe, so you might see some contractors with masonary tools. Our room was on the 4th floor. Water pressure was decent (for UK). Bathroom on the small side, but hey, you're in UK and you don't have to share. Staff was very helpful and courteous. Would recommend, and would stay there again. Hope they don't raise prices anytime soon. (Curiously, it was cheaper to book through a third party booker on the internet than a direct booking with the hotel. Paid avg. GPB 80 per night.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy50
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in Kensington visiting my daughter who was studying abroad for the semester. I found The Montana Hotel in Kensington to be a fabulous value. Compared to other hotels in the area, you couldn't find a better deal. I paid only 39 pounds per night (but had a room without it's own bathroom). I had a sink in the room, a single bed and went down the hall for toilet and shower. I did not wait once to get into the shower and found the hotel overall to be very clean. My sheets were crisp, white and clean and the sink was always scrubbed and shining. My twin bed was brand new. While it was definitely a bit of a pain and inconvenience to walk down the hall to the bathroom, and I did have to go through a door and down some steps, the price made it worth it. With the current exchange rate and prices in London, this was the only great deal I got during my trip. The help was friendly and accommodating. Some of these reviews complain about the white toast for breakfast but, hey, it was included in my low rate, was delivered hot and quickly. After the second day there, the staff remembered that I take coffee, not tea and always greeted me with a smile and a pleasant attitude. The only complaint I would have is that the hotel is undergoing a remodel. The hallways were full of carpentry supplies and they were trying out different types of stain on the woodwork, etc. The carpet in my room was ripped. But, again, for the price it was an excellent deal. I felt safe and everything was very clean - I also felt that the staff truly cared that I was enjoying my stay. The hotel is right across the street from the Gloucester tube station which has a direct route to Heathrow. And, for a little more money, you can certainly have a room with your own bathroom - the ones without are very few but very cheap!!!! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a decent room at a great price - if you are looking for luxury, this isn't for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: BlueNailPolish
Reviews.Content: Just got back from London and a short stay at the Montana. It's a decent little hotel; the best thing about it IMO is the location - tube stop right across the street, tons of shops & a grocery store nearby. And the staff was super helpful and friendly. We stayed in one of the older rooms downstairs, it was a bit...shabby, but reasonably clean. The bedspreads were torn and the blowdryer didn't work. No fridge or coffeemaker, which was disappointing. The newly renovated rooms upstairs looked quite nice however. Worst thing about this place is the "breakfast" : cold toast, powdered juice, and tea or coffee. Yuck! Thank goodness for Waitrose and Tesco's where we could grab yogurt, fruit and muffins on the cheap. All in all not a bad experience, not the greatest but the location makes up for anything lacking. I'd stay there again if I ever get back to London.

Reviews.Title: “Building site !”
Reviews.Author: Globaldandyboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for several years but let me warn you all that its like a construction back lot at the present and they say will be like that till well into late 2007. Having flown transatlantic the last thing I needed was to be disturbed by banging and drilling. The new rooms promise to be really good but they have upped the rates massively to the point where its no longer a deal. Moved to Holiday Inn - same price !

Reviews.Title: “Short Review, with important information”
Reviews.Author: TravelCop
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Montana in March with teenage son for one week trip. This was my fourth stay here in several years. Plusses: Convenient...35-40 min from Heathrow on Piccadilly Line Location...opposite corner from Tube station...2 minute walk Area...pleanty of fast food nearby, including grocery stores Facility...clean, comfortable, with accomodating staff Amenities...provided coffee pot, fan, converter, and power strip upon request Cost...affordable Minuses: Toast for breakfast gets old after a few days Overall, a great little hotel, BUT BIG NEWS!!!! Montana is undergoing a complete remodeling, in progress as this is written. Rooms being completely redone, from top floor down, with new bedding, soft goods, curtains, carpet (red), furniture, refrigerators, flat screen TV with satellite, and wall mounted heater/air-conditioner. Unknown about the bathrooms, but the new rooms were gorgeous. Unfortunately though, the rates have been raised significantly (at least a 50% increase) to well over 100 quid per night. The hotel is no longer a bargain, and is pricing itself out of the casual traveller's affordability range. It will be priced more like the nearby Radisson, Holiday Inns, Millennium Baileys, and Millennium Gloucester. Those with price concerns might check the Park International Hotel, about 800 feet or so down Cromwell Rd. Thanks Montana, its been great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: byrdbud
Reviews.Content: I thought we had reveiwed this hotel straight after our stay there but alas.... better late than never. I stayed at the Montana with my husband for 4 weeks in Oct 2005, and we enjoyed it so much we are staying there again later this year. We booked over the internet after a really long search for a decent hotel at a decent price in a good local in London. Although I had read good reveiws about the hotel I wasn't holding my breath, after all seeing is beleiving. Well we weren't dissapointed and in fact were pleasantly surprised. The reception/bar and dining room were all spotlessly clean. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The continental brekky of toast ( 2 slices each), jam/marmalade, coffee/tea & OJ was enough for us even though it doesn't sound like alot. If you prefer you can order more substantial food for an extra cost but in 4 weeks we didn't bother. toast and coffee is about all we have at home anyway and if you get sick of the spreads BYO. Our room was great, much bigger than we expected. We had room 411 with a double and single bed, small dining table, a nice wardrobe with in room safe and dressing table. There was no tea/coffee facilities in the room which was a shame. The beds were comfy and the linen clean. The bathroom wasn't huge but was roomy enough for my 6ft 2 husband to use without complaining. There was a shower over the bath, toilet and basin with a nice big mirror hiding a nice big cabinet above the basin. The hot water was always hot but the pressure could've been a bit better. We had clean towels and the beds were made every day and the room was really quiet, we had a window that opened onto a quiet mews type area. Yes the lift is small but so what, your only in it a few minutes and if you can't wait for the next one there is always the stairs to keep you healthy. The morning we checked in, we arrived really early (6am) and our room wasn't ready till much later (our fault not theirs). We were invited to leave our bags and relax in the bar/sitting area until the dining room opened when we could have brekky. Well we left our bags and headed out to explore the immediate area in the quite of early morning, it was terrific. ok nothing was open but it was london just waking up so it was pretty special and Hyde Park was wonderful. The only suggestion I would make to improve the hotel is to find a secure area for people to leave their luggage. It was in a corner of the bar/sitting area not visible to the reception staff but easily accessible to anybody else. The dining room that serves brekky in the morning turns into an Indian rest for lunch and dinner and we had dinner there one night and found the food was delicious if a bit pricey but then I've found all indian food is pricey (must be all those expensive spices) and it was pretty comparable to other rests nearby. The Montana's location is just great, walking distance to Harrods, Kensington Palace, Hyde Park, and the V&A and Natural History Museums as well as High St Kensington and Earls Court. Across the road is a post office, Gloucester Rd tube, a bureau de change (or equal). Next to the tube is a small shopping centre with a few restaurants, a Boots chemist, and a Waitrose supermarket. There are lots of other cafe's near by as well as a starbucks. Our highlights were the steak rest and a small itlaian place almost across the road. I think the steak rest was called Blue Fire or something Fire. Also within walking distance was another supermaket Tesco's and a couple of laundymats. We hit the supermarkets every day to buy our lunch of ready made sandwiches or salad or fruit. We found this a much cheaper option than cafes or other sandwich sellars. The sangers were always fresh and had a really wide range of fillings available. For dinner if we couldn't be bothered eating out we'd go to waitrose and head to the deli counter at the back of the store. Next to the deli they had a hot food section where you buy the normal BBQ chicken but also cooked ham hocks, roast duck etc. but just a litlle further along was the counter that sold a huge range cooked ready to eat indian foods. snacks like samosa's & Kebabs, at least 2 types of curry and rice, if it wasn't already hot they would heat it for you. Buy yrself a couple of plastic plates and knifes forks etc and bob's your uncle, your all set. A great cheap eating option if staying a while and would prefer to spend yr pounds sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for family”
Reviews.Author: hogi63
Reviews.Content: If you are a family of 5, don't want to spend a fortune, and want to be handily located, you'd struggle to better this place. It's not luxurious, but it's perfectly adequate for a short stay. Lovely meal had in the attached Indian restuarant too.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: bc12345
Reviews.Content: stayed in large family room (+ ensuite) with plenty of space for 2 adults and 3 children. room very clean. location was excellent. Just across road from tube station with direct line to Victoria Station (perfect for arriving from Gatwick or Heathrow) or westend shows. Open top bus stop just outside hotel door. Nat history museum, etc 5mins walk. Breakfast just tea/coffee/hot choc + juice + toast but could upgrade to full english for extra cost. Had lovely meal in indian restuarant. staff were very helpful. Overall would not have a problem to recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Restaurant attached!”
Reviews.Author: mControl
Reviews.Content: We brought our youngest daughter to London for her birthday. We pre-booked this property because it was inexpensive with a 3 star rating. The beds were lumpy and uncomfortable. The bathrooms were more like what one finds in an RV, only smaller! The people were lovely and that made up for a great deal. We would stay again when traveling with family as it is close to the tube and easy to get where you want to be. Hint- bring movies and dvd/computer as the tv lacks many stations Americans have grown used to getting.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Choice”
Reviews.Author: Travellor_G
Reviews.Content: My experience is that Montana is low quality but cheap. You get what you pay for. Receptionist could learn how to smile, and say please and thank you! Furniture is MFI type! Need good redecoration. Not even a towel rail in the ensuite - just keep your towel over your shoulder!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay at the Montana”
Reviews.Author: DonnaandMorris
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montana for 4 nights in late September of 06. The room was certainly not large & the bathroom was just adequate however the room was very clean. The hotel is very well located being just a block from the subway station & just down the street from Kensington Palace. The best part of our stay was the staff. Very friendly & helpful, particularly Peter, the barman. He seems to know everything about where to eat & what to see etc, Breakfast is included in the room price but it consists only of orange juice, tea or coffee and two slices of white toast each with preserves. If they at least had brown or whole wheat bread I would have been happier. Donna & Morris from Winnipeg, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Depends on your budget”
Reviews.Author: Systrip
Reviews.Content: I booked the Montana hotel primarily for price and location. Overall our stay was ok. There were 3 of us sharing a triple room, which consisted of 3 single beds. However, although I'd requested a room on the 1st or 2nd floor, our room was located in the basement. It looked out onto a tiny (6ft x 6ft) courtyard with a storage room for chemicals which the staff would access several times during the morning/evening. So there was no view and we could only barely see the sky. I had also requested a non-smoking room but there was an ashtray in the room and cigarette burns on the net curtains and bedspreads. The carpets were stained. While the toilet, basin and bath were clean there were significant dampness stains on the bathroom ceiling. There was a very stale smell when we entered the room which prompted one of my fellow travellers to buy some air freshener to use in the room. However due to the courtyard outside we kept the window closed during the day to prevent anyone accessing the room. The hotel has an Indian restaurant so at 9:30 every night the smell of food from the kitchen would waft into the room so again we had to close the window. Therefore the room was incredibly warm; daytime temperatures were in the mid 20s Celsius and it was difficult to sleep due to the heat. The television was very small and had no teletext but range of channels was ok. The elevator is tiny as per previous reviews. It took 3 of us (squashed) or only 2 of us with bags. We had to ask for a kettle and it arrived while we were out of the room so it only included 2 cups. So I asked for a third cup which came relatively quickly. Tea, coffee, sugar and UHT milk were provided. However on another occassion we asked if there was a scissors we could borrow but there was none available in reception and there wasn't really any effort made to find one for us. Our reservation included continental breakfast. At breakfast we were shown to a table, and served orange juice (which I liked but might be weak for some tastes). We were then given a choice of tea or coffee and 2 slices of white toast each. The toast was perfectly cooked and always arrived hot. The service was polite and very prompt, and the server remembered our choices of tea/coffee on the second day. However, I was expecting cereal but it transpired that this would have cost an extra £1.50 per person. The room was cleaned daily and we were given 3 fresh towels and soap. However one point to note is that on Saturday the maid was already cleaning our room when we returned from breakfast at around 8.30. Our room (570) was adjacent to the bathroom of the adjoining room. We could hear our neighbour singing in the shower and also the flush of the toilet. On checking-out we were allowed to leave our luggage but it was in an area just outside the reception desk so I must admit being a bit concerned about how easy it would have been for someone to run off with it. However it was all fine when we came to collect it. I would only recommend this hotel if you are on a semi-restricted budget and are not too fussy about luxuries. Next time I would prefer to pay more and have a higher standard room. In summary, good points: 1) Location of the hotel - literally cross the street for the tube station, some cafés/restaurants/fast food outlets and some small supermarkets 2) We arrived at 11:30 approx and were allowed to check in early. 3) Juice, tea and toast at breakfast Bad points: 1) Location of the room in the basement 2) Overall condition of the room 3) The heat especially at night and having to keep the window closed meant very little fresh air 4) Smells from the kitchen

Reviews.Title: “We Cancelled Reservation for End of Trip & Stayed Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: sylvanandmilton
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Montana was half a block from the Gloucester tube station. The elevator had only room for two people but we had read about hotels in Europe having very small elevators and so we were not entirely surprised but it would have been a problem for people with more luggage. Room 405 had two twin beds which were small for two guys over six feet tall. With the windows open, the room was very noisy since it faced Gloucester Road which is a very busy road. The windows were double paned windows but there was no air conditioning so that closing the window was not an option as it had become pretty warm. With the windows open, the room was very noisy since it faced Gloucester Road which is a very busy road. The windows were double paned windows but there was no air conditioning so that closing the window was not an option as it had become pretty warm. The bathroom was very small but clean. You could barely turn around in the shower though and water pressure wasn't great. The next morning we requested to be moved to a quieter room. The front desk told us to pack our bags and they would move them while we were out during the day. The breakfast was included in the hotel cost which is typical in Europe and consisted of toast, coffee and juice. When we got back to the hotel, they had moved us to room 203 in the back of the hotel. It is quieter and they also furnished us with a fan. The bathroom is still very small, only one person can be in there at one time. While we had been out, we had passed the Park International Hotel about two blocks away and saw a sign that they had air conditioning. We asked to look at a room there and liked it much better than the Montana and so we canceled our reservation at the Montana for the end of our trip and booked a room at the Park International in the internet and got a better room for less money.

Reviews.Title: “No air conditioning during heatwave”
Reviews.Author: beyondthesea
Reviews.Content: Room was satisfactory except for being on the 3rd floor during a heatwave in London and no air conditioning. The common area on the bottom floor had air (where the employees work), but not our room. This really needs to be updated. Also, no wash cloths at the Montana. I was told "we don't do wash cloths. You can buy one at the pharmacy down the street". The room, was however, very clean. The bathroom was spotless. The water pressure in the shower was very low though. The employees were not very congenial at this hotel. For the price, I would seek out another hotel on my next trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Sweating It Out At The Montana”
Reviews.Author: stevelevy99
Reviews.Content: Location is terrific. Value is good. Quality is average. London is expensive. The Montana serves it's purpose. I've stayed numerous times. The room is very hot. I'm 6'2, and had to duck in the shower. If you're looking for a bargain and a simple place to rest your head at night, the Montana is for you. The front desk staff is friendly, and the hotel is safe.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, budget, but always a London hotel”
Reviews.Author: brazilianwanderlust
Reviews.Content: The Montana hotel is an option for the rest of us who live in countries unfavored by the exchange rate of the pound sterling. Two great countries are rich in bad hotel experiences. England, because it's so expensive and who can afford good hotels there? And Italy, because they have the most beautiful places, so what do they care about building good hotels? That applies for the Montana. It's one of those hotels that you tolerate staying at just because you're in London. OK, it's located in a very convenient place in London, the subway/tube is right across the street, there's a decent indian restaurant downstairs, it's affordable in London terms. But the rooms are small and smelly, decoration is ugly, bathrooms are tight and the sinks are so narrow that it's impossible to brush your teeth above it, otherwise you hit your head against the mirror. But you're in London. If you want more you have to pay more, and just because of that the Montana is an option. By the way: try not to exchange money at the places across the street because they charge high comissions. In London, always look for places that do not charge comissions, even though they may be hard to find.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: am5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Montana in December of 2004 for a few days with my mom. Although it isn't a luxurious hotel, it is fine for coming back to after a day of being out in the city. I returned to london in May and June of 2006 and booked 2 weeks at the Montana again. I am a student and I have found that the Montana hotel is the most affordable place in London besides hostels (which are usually very dirty and overcrowded in London). I called the hotel directly to book my reservation and they gave me a single room with a bathroom down the hall for 35 pounds a night, with the 7th night free. This is a very good deal for london, considering that breakfast is included too. The breakfast of toast and coffee or tea does get old very quickly though. I wish they would add some cold cereals or muffins or something else to the menu as well. The rooms can be a bit noisy if you are on the side that looks over gloucester road or cromwell road. I only found the noise to be a problem my first night there, after that I adjusted to it. Each room is cleaned well and is supplied with a towel and a bar of soap. Bring your own washcloth and shampoo because they do not supply them. I personally think that the staff at the hotel are very friendly and accomodating. I became very ill on the day I was supposed to fly to London and I had to change my flight to a few days later. This meant I would not be able to check into the Montana when I was supposed to in less than 24 hours. They usually require 48 hours notice for cancelling but they let me change my reservations with less than 24 hours notice at no charge. I booked a week at the Montana in June as well and at first they did not have any single rooms available so I would have had to pay a higher price. But when I arrived at the hotel I found that they had done some rearranging and they managed to get me into the cheaper single room. A lot of people on here seem to complain about the lack of space in the rooms but i found my room to be very spacious even though in America it would be smaller than some people's walk in closets. I don't know what people need all the space for. The rooms definitely provide enough space for luggage, a sink, a bed, dresser, and a tv. They all have windows too, which surprisingly not every hotel room in London has. So overall I find the Montana a very good deal and I recommend it for the budget traveller who will only be there to sleep or watch tv. I will definitely stay here every time I return to London.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My 2 girlfriends & I stayed in this hotel in April in a Triple Room. Rooms are small as all London Hotels but we found this to be comfortable for what we wanted. Reasonably priced for Kensington and it is in a great location. Friendly staff and helpful when we required it. Don't expect to fit anymore than one person with suitcases in the lift though. Didn't try the resturant but quite a few pubs etc in the local area. Underground straight across the road which is very handy. Also ATM's machines and money exchange right next door. Would recommend for a reasonably priced short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Served the purpose”
Reviews.Author: JanHeed
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Montana Hotel Kensington for one week in April for our trip to London. This hotel was the least expensive hotel offered in a package deal with the tour company we went with. I wasn't expecting much from the hotel, but all we wanted was a decent place to stay in, which it was. The hotel is in a nice location...it was very convenient and felt safe. Gloucester tube station is just across the street from the hotel, and you can catch the Piccadilly line, the Circle line, and the District line from this tube station. The hotel is right on the corner of Cromwell and Gloucester, very close to a Barclay's bank, an internet cafe, currency exchange, a 24 hour Tesco, a nice little restaurant, a pub, Starbuck's, KFC, and more. The hotel lobby is just as it is on their website pictures. Their lift (elevator) can fit two people comfortably, and four people tightly...not ideal to use if you're closter-phobic. Didn't make use of their bar in the hotel, so can't really comment on it. We had "continental breakfast" included with our stay...and as mentioned in previous reviews, it's just a lot of toast, jam, butter, orange juice, coffee, and tea...this breakfast was perfect for me because I don't usually eat a heavy breakfast, so it was just fine. The dining area was clean and no problems with the service there. We must have had the smallest twin/double room in the hotel because it was very narrow (I posted pics with this review). But it had what we needed: twin beds, a good size wardrobe, a tv that worked with a few channels (don't think there was satellite though), a dresser, a large window, a chair, hairdryer, and a private full bathroom (which seemed more spacious than the rest of the room). We checked in at 11am and our room wasn't ready yet. It still had to be cleaned but they gave us the key (card) to the room so that we can leave our luggage in there if we wanted to go out into the city. The cleaning lady was working on our floor (the 3rd floor) when we got to the room and told us that it would be another hour or two before the room was ready since the earliest check in and latest check out times are about the same...this didn't really bother us because we had to catch a train to Manchester soon anyway. When we got back from Manchester, our room was cleaned and were each given clean a towel and a small bar of soap. Our room was cleaned everyday and we were given new towels and soap everyday, plus sheets were changed daily. Our bathroom was clean enough (could have been cleaner to my high standards, but was ok), and there was plenty of hot water. A particular person at the front desk sometimes could have been a bit nicer, but it didn't kill our stay at the hotel or anything. Our room was at the corner of the hotel, where Glocester and Cromwell meet, but the street noise didn't bother us...get earplugs for sleeping if you're concerned and it will do just fine. We had no disruptions when sleeping; the hotel was quiet. The smell of the room wasn't as fresh as I was hoping for because I'm a non-smoker and I was sure that the people who stayed in our room just prior to us did smoke in the room. But when our room was cleaned, they left the window a bit ajar to air it out daily. I probably wouldn't want to stay at this hotel in the summer because it doesn't have air conditioning, but in April it was just fine. The hotel is not a modern property, it's an older property...so expect to see an older property and don't expect a spacious north-american-style room. I'd classify this hotel as a 2 and a half star. There's nothing fancy about this hotel, but it has the basics and is clean. A bit more luxury and higher room standard would have been nice (which is what I will go for elsewhere on my next visit to London), but for the budget price we paid and since we were out and about in the city and other parts of England all day everyday, the hotel did the job...was able to sleep, keep our clothes and belongings there safely, and took hot showers. Location was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Encore Visit!!”
Reviews.Author: ninernut
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in 2004...Came back in 2006...Same experience, same staff, same review...It's just a great tourist class hotel, in a perfect location in South Ken, as described by other reviewers....On one day, had a problem with hot water to third floor due to water main breakage in Kensington; didn't think much about it in the morning, came back from a day of sightseeing and wanted to take a shower...still no hot water. Desk offered to let me use a room on 1st floor for shower....Great!!...hot water returned later that night...Planning to attend British Open in 2010, without doubt will be staying at Montana for a few nights before heading to St. Andrews....Don't waste your time and money elsewhere...You will not beat it for value, location, convenience, experience in a tourist class hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, though chintzy”
Reviews.Author: FearlessFred
Reviews.Content: The Montana offers basic accommodations in a terrific Kensington location -- close to a good array of attractions, including Kensington Palace, and across the street from Picadilly, Circle and District Tube lines. No shortage of pubs, Starbucks (two within three blocks) or grocery stores. But there are caveats. If you are booking a single room, be prepared to face Gloucester Road, which is loud. The double windows knock down some of the sound, but earplugs are really needed to survive. I couldn't imagine staying here in the summer with the windows open. Many of the doubles face an inner courtyard, and I suspect that noise there isn't an issue. The room came with a single towel and tiny soap bar, but for the price in this district, allowances have to be made for the price-point here. The room, although slightly warn, was clean and comfortable. Upon arrival, I had a problem with the in-room safe, and it was repaired within minutes. For the morning repast, billed as a "continental breakfast," expect little: one small glass of orange juice, two slices of toast and a cup of coffee (refills available by cajoling the server... it shouldn't be this difficult). Anything else costs extra.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Montana Hotel twice in the last 2 years. O.K it is very basic but provides all of the facilities that a traveller on a budget would want. Why pay 150 pounds a night just to spend less than 8 hours in a room. Hey, if you are going to London for a holiday then surely you will be out and about not wondering why you don't have 30+ channels on your T.V. One word of advise though....ask for a room on the lower floors as the water pressure for the shower is better down there. Hope to stay there next May for the Clapton Concerts. Talk to Peter the barman, he is a mine of information. Trevor Perth Western Australia

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We give this hotel above average just because they have frendly staff, great location, OK rooms and the rates are reasonable for London. Breakfast is not much, but then again there are several options close to the hotel. For those traveling on a strict budget, this hotel might be an option. We will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your dollar”
Reviews.Author: jimc2
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, less than 100 meters to the subway which we took directly from Heathrow airport for only 3.7 pounds. Hotel is very clean. Rooms are compact but so are the rates. Great on site, personable pub, a full pint for only 2 pounds. Peter the Bartender/morning waiter is just the best. Whatever you want to know about London and getting connections around the city, talk to Peter. Very helpful and personable. This hotel offers a free continental breakfast of beverage and toast, or order eggs and trimmings for 2 pounds. You can't beat it. The restaurant offers Indian cuisine. Amazingly delicious, staff are "very" professional and friendly. Food prices are competitive. Neighbourhood is safe and top shelf, with numerous pubs, restaurants and shops. Walk to Kensington Palace, Hyde Park, Museums, Herrods. Short bus ride or underground to downtown London. This Hotel is exactly what you see on their web site. The surrounding hotels including the Hotel right next door and the Holiday Inn a couple of blocks away are double the price for what the Montana offers. Will book there in the future. Regards, Jim Carver Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Friendly service and reasonable prices!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Considering how costly London is already, we needed a hotel that was conveniently located, clean, and reasonably priced - which is exactly what the Montana Hotel has to offer. Although the rooms are basic, (eg. no A/C, few TV chanels (but who cares...i would hope people would have better things to do in London, and the rooms are a bit tight), its still a fair bargain. We stayed 2 nights at teh Holiday Inn Kensington Forum just around the corner, and that seemed to be to expensive. This place offered 50 Brit. pounds less and was within walking distance. The only negative comment I had was with regards to the pathetic Continental Breakfast. It really did't consist of much - toast/jam (unlike Holiday Inn). Otherwise - I higly recommend this place...

Reviews.Title: “great value location and staff, but not elegant”
Reviews.Author: drummerliz
Reviews.Content: This is a great value for London at 65 quid per night. It's nothing fancy. out of date furnishings, slight smell of smoke, bed really hard. I had to sleep with the window closed because my ground floor room faced an alleyway where staff either lived or hung out and it sounded like a toilet was running at all times. closing the window completely eliminated this problem. The room had a big deep bathtub-perfect for soaking after tramping through london as a tourist. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the indian food at the restaurant was great. I had the continental breakfast which was really good toast (I'm not sure how) coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice. for 4 quid you can upgrade to full english breakfast-sounds expensive, but check the price of that upgrade at other london hotels-typically 15-20 quid. Great location for hop on -hop off tour bus and getting around on the tube. clean good neighborhood, drugstores banks restaurants all right there.

Reviews.Title: “The Montana is a tourist class hotel...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had to keep reminding myself that London is expensive and that this hotel was in a good location and was a tourist class hotel - I shouldn't expect much. The location couldn't be better - an easy ride from Heathrow via the tube, and it sits across the street from the Gloucester Rd Tube stop. Perfect for all the running around I did on my visit. The rooms were noisy due to the fact most rooms face the busy Gloucester Rd. We found that by closing the windows and getting a fan from the front desk, we could sleep much better. This was possible because the "heat wave" had broken. I'm not sure if it would have been possible if it was much warmer. Maybe earplugs would have done the trick in that case. The hotel was clean, but a bit run down. Nothing fancy. I was told the breakfast was white toast and an orange drink rather than juice. So I skipped it and ate down the road at the Cafe Forum for GBP 2.50. I was quoted GBP 65 for a room with a bath via LondonBy.com and was charged GBP 69 at check out. I'm working on this problem, but it has upset me. I think all in all it was an ok place to stay. Location outweighed the problems. I wasn't in the room much, so it was really only used to sleep. Not the hotel for a romantic getaway, but it works well for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Could do a lot better!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: To start, we didn't receive a particularly friendly greeting. The twin room we were given didn't look like the pictures we saw on the net - while the room was clean, it had not been redecorated in years. The only satellite channel on the TV did not work either. As there was no air conditioning and it was extremely hot out, we had to leave the window open at night, but with the noise outside, it was not easy to sleep. We requested a fan the next morning, and though we were told they would drop one up to the room, this never arrived. The continental breakfast was limited and we felt the £2 charge (per person!!) for bringing this to the room was unnecessary. The only plus was the location, right beside the tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Montana Hotel for 7 nights but could only stay there one night because of the noise and the hot room. The hotel is situated in an excellent location near the tube and the staff is very nice but the room left a lot to be desired. The rooms are quite small, disjointed, and run-down and the lift doesn't always take you really close to your room without lugging your luggage up a flight of stairs. There is no air-conditioning in the room and even though it was May, it was quite warm so we had to open our window for some air but couldn't stand all the sirens and noise all night long from the busy intersection nearby so ended up getting no rest at all and moving to a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: linpat
Reviews.Content: Terrific value for the price and a location that can't be beat. Small clean rooms but convenient to the tube station. My only negative is that when I asked the desk to call a taxi to go to Victoria Station, he called a relative or friend who turned out not to be have a licensed taxi and charged 25-30% more than the estimate. I thought that it was unfair to the real drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Convenient Location!”
Reviews.Author: alohabear
Reviews.Content: Although this was not my first stay in Kensington, I wanted to stay somewhere close to the museums on Cromwell Road. Firstly, I was pleasantly surprised at the convenience of the hotel's location. Directly across the street on Gloucester Road is an internet cafe which one of the hotel staff suggested I use instead of the hotel's internet. Diagonal from the hotel is Gloucester Road tube station, where the tube lines take you to just about all the popular routes and locations for sightseeing, a supermarket, drug store and cafe within the mall. On Gloucester Road there are plenty of places to eat, satisfying most pallets. As for the hotel itself, I had one issue which was resolved almost instantly. The pressure of the hand-held shower was low (be prepared to hold it with one hand while going about your business). I reported it to the front desk on my way out and by the time I returned, the problem was resolved. The room I stayed in literally fit the full-size bed with about 12" leeway from side to side. The bed was comfortable but one has to be careful about the step that leads you to the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT value!!!”
Reviews.Author: ga2rdoc
Reviews.Content: Reservations had been mishandled by agent but receptionist was overwhelmingly nice and reassuring that it would all be worked out!! Had two different triple rooms for the week and they were very spacious and scrupulously clean. Modern baths. Small elevator. Adequate breakfast, excellent Indian restaurant, very affordable (by London prices)for dinner. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Tube stop about 100 feet from door. Outside upkeep superb - certainly looks more expensive than it is. Have friends going to London in two weeks and they already have reservations. You can be sure that I will return! Have travelled extensively and this was near the top for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good All rounder”
Reviews.Author: bertifi
Reviews.Content: we stayed in for 2 nights at this hotel - family room - it was ready when we checked in and had 4 proper beds! Room basic with no tea/coffee stuff but we were not there long anyway - just to sleep basically. Hotel is right over the road from Gloucester Road tube station which has all the connections you need for your stay! Breakfast served in the hotel is basic - oj / tea/ coffee and toast with jam that is all dont expect anything else without having to pay £4.50 gets you a full cooked brekkie or £1.50 for cereal - the toast was fine gets you out the door in the morning! The staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. Altogether a good hotel for a short stay in London at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Woow what a place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Woow what a beautiful hotel...just loctaed in walking distance from the tube providing easy access to centrral london..The staff at Montana are absolute angels what can i say...they made mine and my wifes stay most pleasurable and something worth remembering..we stayed for 7 nights and for each of those nights we enjoyed ourselves to the upmost..the staff are so friendly and pleasant...ifwe needed any thing we had good service..The lift was a tad small but for the location, staff friendliness and excellent value for money.. The other hotels in the area were much dear and there was not much comparitiv differemce..Thunbs up chaps and we would most defintely stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great value hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: trollafdf
Reviews.Content: I researched hotels in London for several weeks before deciding on the Montana. I am glad I did. This hotel, although a little worn is great value for London. We were traveling as a family and the price and location was perfect. The Indian Restaurant was very good and the hotel and restaurant staff were very friendly. With minuscule rooms being the norm in London, the family size room we had was good sized. The hotel was very clean. We had stayed in another London Hotel in February, 2004 and although the rates were cheaper it was really shabby. If you are looking for a clean, safe, reasonably priced hotel in London then this is the place to stay. Great rates available on Hotel-assist.

Reviews.Title: “Good Little Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Montana Hotel on 17 November. We needed a cheap hotel for our last night in London and we liked the Gloucester Road area. They quoted us a price of 75 pounds and my husband bargained the rate down to 65 pounds. Our room was larger than I expected for a budget hotel. It had a double bed and also a twin bed. The down side was the bathroom was the size of a closet but it was clean and there was plenty of hot water. Also, the bed was extremely hard but it was okay for one night. Breakfast was included in the rate. The free breakfast consisted of coffee, tea or juice and toast. Anything else was extra but the free breakfast was adequate. Would probably stay there again if nothing else was available mainly because I liked the area.
